Job Description:
At Maximus Group, our vision is to be the leader in providing full stream supply chain solutions to our customers in transportation, fulfillment, procurement, and light assembly and manufacturing.

We strive to anticipate our customer needs, provide added value, and exceed our customer’s requirements and expectations. We are continuously driving process improvements with the goal of providing the highest quality to our customers.

Position Overview:

We are a fast-growing manufacturing and logistics company, and we’ve already had our Digital Transformation started. We are not afraid of experiments and are ready to implement new technologies and automate processes, which require a wide range of skill sets. As a BA you will work with users in various business areas to identify change needs, assess the impact of the change, capture and document requirements, and then ensure those requirements are delivered, all while supporting the Company through the implementation process. Duties will include, but are not limited to:

Primary Responsibilities

To lead ongoing reviews of business processes, define business requirements and bottlenecks, identify opportunities to grow, optimize, improve and automate the organization’s business processes, and develop optimization strategies.
Help internal departments (including IT) run more efficiently and become an agent of change for the entire organization.
Partner with the rest of the organization by evaluating the business models and documenting the organizational processes along with steps to reach a certain point (as is -> to be)
Documentation and policy ownership: Create and update IT procedures, troubleshooting steps, and user guides. Contribute to the development of the workforce’s knowledge base to promote self-help resources.
Assist with project management for selected projects.
Develop functional specifications and provide training/instruction for the new systems, modifications, new applications, security policies and workflows.
Create reports, dashboards and visualizations to help others understand business performance.
Develop and maintain reporting tools.
Implement new projects and applications for the Team, define and collect metrics of success.
Work with internal Team and external Service Providers as needed to ensure compliance with Data Architecture and Security.
Hardware and software maintenance as needed: Install, configure, and maintain computer hardware, peripherals, and software applications. Perform regular updates, patches, and system upgrades to ensure security and optimal performance. Maintain an inventory of IT assets, track equipment warranties, and manage licensing. Procure new hardware as needed.

Competencies and Qualifications

Ability to use logic and critical thinking in problem-solving, including the ability to look at a problem using a big-picture approach and consider multiple options.
Extensive knowledge of data, including investigation, transformation, analysis and visualization.
Excellent knowledge of MS Tools including Power BI.
Knowledge and skills applicable to secondary tools such as Microsoft Azure, Power Platform, SQL data warehouse, Visual Studio, Crystal Reports, etc.
Expertise in database management systems and the SQL and XML programming language, hands-on experience in interface building (API functions).
Detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy.
Cost-benefit analysis.
Processes modeling.
> 2 years of hands-on solid experience with successful systems/processes implementation.
Ability to handle multiple projects and workstreams simultaneously.
Ability to prioritize and work in a rapidly changing, fast-growth environment.
Education field of study: Data management and analysis, information systems management or computer science

Knowledge and Skills:

Programming languages like R and Python.

Skills in statistics and mathematics.

Extensive background in solving data architecture/storage concerns across Cloud, IaaS/PaaS/SaaS, Mainframe, AI, data integrations, data provisioning, data security/privacy, complex data pipelines, data warehouses, data mesh, data virtualization, and data consumption.
Hands-on experience with solution design.
Experience with Data, Big Data and Analytics architecture and ecosystem, cloud technologies along with knowledge of industry best practices.
Strong knowledge of computer hardware, operating systems (Windows, macOS), and software applications like SAP b1, McLeod, RTA, Samsara, etc.
Microsoft Administrator certification is highly desirable.
Familiarity with network protocols and security practices

Working Environment:

The IT Business Analyst will primarily work in an office environment.
This is a stationary position, must be able to remain in a stationary position for extended periods of time
Consistently operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine, and computer printer.
Interaction with colleagues, clients, and management is integral to the position.
Must be able to exchange accurate information in collaborative setting.
Occasionally moves objects weighing up to 50 pounds across the office for various needs.
The office may have normal noise levels and standard office equipment.

The job description is intended to outline the key duties and qualifications associated with the position; however, it may not encompass all tasks or skills that may be required.

Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

This position is in our Finance/Accounting department and more specifically in our Financial Operations group. The primary objective of this role is to ensure the Finance/Accounting department performs as efficiently as possible for MedPro Group. In the role, you will have the opportunity to be involved in one or many of the following areas: financial system administration, cross-functional projects, business development and integration, metrics and key performance indicators (KPI's), and various process improvement projects.

In this role, you will…

Drive and support financial operations and financial systems.
Continuously identify process improvements and technological solutions.
Collaborate with IT and various stakeholder groups.
Lead and/or support various cross-functional projects.
Support business development and integration by driving consistent processes across the finance group.
Lead and/or drive financial system operations and performance.
Gather and analyze financial KPI's and metrics across the business.
Prepare various operational process flows in PowerPoint/Visio.
Provide assistance to any area of Finance/Accounting as needed.
Perform other duties as assigned.

We are looking for candidates with…

Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Project Management.
Preferred 3-5 years of experience in a wide range of financial disciplines (AP, AR, Financial reporting, regulatory reporting, audit, risk, etc.).
Ideally 1-3 years of insurance experience.
Experience with system implementation and large scale process changes (preferred).
Curiosity and integrity, and highly motivated with strong communication skills.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively.
Keen ability to identify and/or execute on process improvements.
A controllership mindset.
Strong technical ability to work with data - Excel, Tableau, and various ODBC systems.
PowerPoint skills (preferred).

Why MedPro?

MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – makes MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

POSITION PURPOSE
The business analyst – Customer Service- will manage and interpret data to improve IndyGo's customer service, support technology projects, and assist with data-driven decision-making in the Public Affairs division. This position will provide critical insights and support regarding opportunities to generate revenue, including creating sales agreements and transit pass programs. The business analyst position will evaluate business processes, financial transactions, and various market data to ensure quality, efficiency, and equity in the customer service program.

The salary range is $53,000 - $59,000 annually, commensurate with education and experience.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
To succeed in this role, an individual must perform the functions listed below satisfactorily. The company will make reasonable accommodations to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these functions.

Essential Functions
Documents customer service business processes to provide training for employees.
Analyzes business processes and workflows to identify improvements.
Identifies issues and assists in developing systematic resolution in all aspects of customer service operations.
Assists with the development of requirements for new technology projects.
Tracks, analyzes, and forecasts trends in online and counter-retail sales.
Tracks analyzes, and reports customer comment/complaint trends.
Assures quality of financial transactions including cash and electronic payments.
Supports transit pass programs: reports usage, ensures quality in billing and transactions of executed transit pass agreements with employers, institutions, and social service agencies.
Develops and maintains metrics to support marketing and sales campaigns.
Facilitates deployment and testing of new hardware and software solutions.
Supports Public Affairs on various aspects of program development and evaluation.
Assists with project management.
Understands and communicates customer perspective, and advocates for issue resolution.
Investigates transportation operations and financial data in various software platforms.
Critically reviews customer service operations and recommends policies and protocols to safeguard assets.

OTHER FUNCTIONS
Performs other duties as assigned.


EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE
To perform this job successfully, an individual must have the following education and/or experience.
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Technology, Project Management, or a related field
Experience in managing technology resources is desired.
Project Management experience is desired.
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES
The requirements below represent the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.
Must have experience using Microsoft Visio, Microsoft SharePoint Project Implementation, and Microsoft 365.
Above average technology skills with the ability to use and advise functionality requirements of web-based applications.
Ability to develop reports and analyze data to forecast trends.
Proficiency in using a computer and related technology, including proficiency with Microsoft Office, the internet, software applications, and aptitude for learning new software or applications.
Ability to interact with internal and external constituents in person and through phone, e-mail, and written correspondence.
Above-average decision-making and problem-solving abilities.
Good presentation skills and the ability to communicate with groups.
Above-average mathematical abilities (addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division).
Ability to prioritize, organize, and manage tasks and time effectively.
Ability to operate office equipment, including copiers, fax machines, and phones.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands described here represent those an individual must meet to perform the essential functions of this job successfully.
Ability to work in a deadline-oriented office environment.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Ability to remain stationary for extended periods of time and move throughout the workday, occasionally between departments and facilities.

We are looking for dedicated employees to join our team to help our customers have the best experience possible every time they enter a DTLR store.
Our employees are key to our success.
POSITION SUMMARY:
We are looking for Business Systems Analyst to be part of team. The ideal candidate is a self-starter that thrives in a fast-moving environment, with a passion for solving customer problems using cutting-edge solutions. You will be trained on the configuration skills specific to DTLR if applicable to the role but should also bring with you an ability to learn new software quickly as well as a business analysis skill set to understand a business problem and break it down into resolvable pieces. You will be working with the customers directly to elicit requirements, as well as configuring and testing the solution to ensure quality. You should also have superb communication, organization, and time management skills. Most importantly, you are committed to the success of projects and customer satisfaction.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Effectively evaluate a client’s needs and business processes. Translate, communicate, and document the requirements to the solution.
 Skilled at mapping data files and processes.
 Skilled at documenting requirements and communicate workflow through diagrams (e.g. create process flow diagrams, integration diagrams, finite state diagrams, customer experience maps, etc.)
 Ability to succinctly communicate solution and requirements to customer and internal team.
 Excellent facilitation skill to collaborate with the clients through decision-making process and gain consensus to reach sign-off.
 Execute and effectively document test to sign-off on solution quality.
 Excellent presentation skills to demo and present the solution to the clients.

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE
 Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration or other relevant university discipline.
 Experienced with enterprise software implementation or Software as a Service (SaaS) implementation projects.
 Experience with Web-Applications and/or SaaS preferred.
 Experienced in analyzing and documenting business processes. Demonstrated ability to bring clarity to business processes that may not be well understood by customers themselves.

SKILLS AND ABILITIES
 Ability to translate business requirements to technical specification for implementation or development.
 Understanding concepts of data modelling and system configuration.
 Strong communication skills. Excellent verbal and written English skills are critical for success in this role.
 Thrives in a fast-paced environment. Demonstrated ability to work calmly in a demanding work environment subject to a variety of pressures and constraints.
 Proficient in MS Office, MS Project, MS Excel, MS Visio
 Knowledge and experience in Retail ERP software solutions or environments are a plus but not required.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
 While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit.
 The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and talk; or hear.
 The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
 Specific vision abilities required by this job may include close vision, distance vision and depth perception.
 The incumbent must be able to work in a fast-paced environment.

Job Title: IT Business Analyst

Reporting Relationship: Director of Project Management

Unit: Central Administration

Department: It Client Engagement Services-Central Administration

Campus Location: Maxwell Center

Summary of Position: The Business Analyst assists the Project Management Office in the charting, scoping, tracking, and execution of projects and requests. The Business Analyst provides consistent, high quality data analysis, troubleshooting, research and issue resolution, and leads both external and internal client projects. This position seeks to address client needs by engaging the appropriate IT resources to provide and implement solutions that align to their goals and objectives needs.

The overall goal of this position is to provide collaborative support to the Project Management Office by ensuring customer projects are appropriately scoped in terms of resources, timing, and completion requirements. The ability to track and understand resources required to achieve customer objectives is paramount. This position will partner closely with the Director of Project Management, and together, will ensure effective project management and communication is occurring at all times. An important aspect of this role is the ability to work with internal and external resources to better understand what it will take to successfully score, onboard, and ultimately deliver projects to the institution. The Business Analyst will work on Small/Medium scale projects and will be required to partner with all IT divisions to effectively serve the needs of the customer. The ability to work closely with IT Directors and support personnel to gather business requirements and ensure resources are effectively allocated and managed is critical. The Business Analyst is a member of the Project Management Office and participates in establishing its goals, strategies, and performance indicators for success.


Duties and Responsibilities

Foster effective communication between IT and external clients
Effectively scope the resources, including cost, duration, and personnel, as well as business requirements/dependencies necessary to complete a project
As needed, assist in the guidance of client projects through the portfolio prioritization process
Assist with strategic oversight to ensure IT delivers an effective solution
Follow-up complex problems using tools and resources available
Develop and execute project plans with the objective of maintaining client satisfaction
Complete projects and address issues in an accurate, timely manner
Recommend project improvements to clients related to desired outcomes
Ensure timely completion and follow-up on action items, client requests and vendor requirements
Set realistic and accurate expectations with clients on IIT’s ability to deliver on project objectives and timelines
Keep up-to-date on new trends and technology related to client projects
Make recommendations and provide insights on resources needed to complete client projects
Assist in ensuring effective project updates and communication is occurring between the Project Management Office and IT as a whole
Working with the Director of Project Management, produce and disseminate dashboards and reports to ensure the project status is visible to all clients. This includes reports on budget, timeline, milestones, and all deliverables
Act as a Project Management resource when requested
Other duties may be assigned

Develop and maintain customized operational reports across multiple business areas for use by department heads and senior management, including:
Department dashboards

Interpret data and apply business concepts to analyze results and provide value-add insights, such as determining operational impact, trends, and/or opportunities

Capture, analyze, and report accurate business and financial data that is critical to business decisions and applies critical thinking skills to interpret the data.

Strong analytical background with the ability to understand statistical concepts.

Demonstrated experience with Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Visio).

Ability to negotiate, prioritize and handle complex people and situations.

Strong technical aptitude and excellent written and oral communication skills.

Ability to successfully communicate critical instruction both written and verbally.

Knowledge of IT systems.

Extraordinary organizational and interpersonal skills, and the ability to self-manage.

Accuracy, thoroughness, timeliness, and dependability are critical skills. Must be able to take initiative and be flexible.

Job Title: Business Policy Analyst - Hybrid in Indianapolis, IN
Job Description:
WHO WE ARE

Delineate is an Indianapolis-based boutique consulting firm that works across many sectors and topic areas to provide data science, policy analysis, business intelligence, and management consulting support. Delineates team of innovators and award-winning visionaries bring a wealth of experience and energy to all projects. We’re pragmatic problem-solvers, experienced policy professionals, distinguished academics, and scientists focused above all else on translating data into action.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

Delineate is hiring a business/policy analyst. In this role, you will help our clients in the private, public, and social sectors solve some of their most pressing problems. You'll work in teams of typically 2-4 consultants to identify and oftentimes implement potential solutions for a specific client problem or challenge. Together, we will help clients make lasting improvements to their performance and realize their most important outcomes. Over the course of each project, you will gather and analyze information, formulate and test hypotheses, and develop and communicate recommendations. You may also present results to clients and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members. As a business analyst, you will receive training and coaching on how to better:

Structure ambiguous problems and take action to solve them.
Synthesize complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methods.
Work effectively with diverse teams to find the best solution and move people and organizations to act.
Establish trust-based relationships with clients to better serve their organizations.
Communicate effectively across many audiences, including senior leadership.
Develop your leadership style, leveraging your own passions, strengths, and personal values.

Qualifications:

Undergraduate degree or master’s degree
1+ years of work experience after degree preferred
Degree in a related field, such as political science, public policy, public health, economics, or data science, preferred
Ability to work collaboratively in a team and create an inclusive environment with people at all levels of an organization
Capability to drive an independent workstream in the context of a broader team project
Comfort with ambiguous, ever-changing situations
Ability to break down and solve problems through quantitative thinking and analysis
Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English

Job Title: Business Readiness Deployment Analyst
Time Period: November 2023 – June 2025
Location: Hybrid, with occasional site visits to Merrillville, IN
Hours/Week: 40 hours
Pay Rate: $60/hour


Scope of Services:

In the role of Business Readiness Deployment Analyst, your responsibilities encompass the meticulous coordination of transformation project work deployment. This involves conducting thorough research to secure appropriate spaces, both within the company and external facilities, for project activities. You will be pivotal in crafting comprehensive deployment and training schedules, detailing locations, dates, times, and participants. Your collaborative efforts extend to interfacing with scheduling and dispatch centers, ensuring the accurate coordination of employees for training sessions. Additionally, you will work closely with Lead Training Coordinators to integrate schedules into the Company learning system, facilitating seamless alignment. As changes arise in business requirements, you will liaise with field leaders, scheduling and dispatch, and steady-state training to adjust established schedules accordingly. Monitoring deployment plans for accuracy and timeline adherence, you will proactively identify and communicate risks to deployment and program leadership, ensuring the smooth progression of the transformation project.


Role, Responsibilities and Deliverables:

Completed research and reservation of space at company or external facilities for transformation project work deployment
Creation of deployment/training schedules for transformation project work that will include locations, dates, times and training attendees
Collaborate and interface with scheduling and dispatch centers to ensure employees are properly scheduled to attend training/sessions
Collaborate and interface with Lead Training Coordinators to ensure scheduled offerings are set up in the Company learning system matching created schedules
Collaborate and interface with field leaders, scheduling and dispatch, and steady state training for movement and adjustments of established schedules based on business requirement changes
Monitoring deployment plans for accuracy and timeline progression
Raise risks to deployment and program leadership as necessary




Qualifications:

3+ years of experience in role with:

Experience creating deployment and training schedules
Strong organizational skills
Communication and planning skills
Strong facilitation and collaboration skills
Flexibility to work with multiple business functions/capabilities

To apply, please submit a resume outlining your relevant experience and approach to Business Readiness Deployment Support. Short-listed candidates will be expected to complete a Blue Star Partners Bio.

Job Title: Business Operations Analyst
Reports to: Distribution Supplies Manager
Location: Mooresville, Indiana

The Role

As a Business Operations Analyst for Deckers Distribution function, you will provide administrative, financial and analytical support across the various distribution centers in North America, including supporting procurement, budgeting, forecasting, billing, invoicing, and operational reporting/analytics processes. you will be required to comply with the Deckers COVID-19 Program Policy

We celebrate diversity--of your background, your experiences and your unique identity. We are committed to ensuring an inclusive and equitable workplace where all of our employees can Come as They Are. We believe that when we bring our different perspectives to work, we are truly Better Together.

Your Impact

You will provide administrative, financial and analytical support across the various distribution centers in North America/Midwest.

The primary functions of this role, include but are not limited to:

Clearly understand facility leases, vendor agreements and lease contracts, billing opportunities and facility budgets.

Maintain purchase order process to ensure compliance with internal guidelines and processes. Auditing and timely processing of incoming vendor invoices, credits and accruals. Partner with AP, suppliers, and various internal teams to ensure timely resolution of vendor payment issues.
Independently process month end procedures to ensure accurate and timely cost recognition and results presentation.
Preparation of financial/operational reports for local management with P&L impact. Provide variance analysis Actual vs. Forecasts and Budgets. Assist with budgeting, forecasting and re-forecasting.
Provide procurement operations support, including forecasting of non-inventory products, inventory management, non-inventory flow and space models, cycle counts, supplier management, procurement transaction, and expediting support
Track KPIs to measure, control, and benchmark procurement processes including creation of recurring metrics reports to drive improvements both operationally and financially. Align with internal customers, Finance, and Procurement Operations to understand budgetary targets by building and developing methods of measuring and defining savings, value, and other Operations metrics.

Who You Are

Team Player
People Person
Positive Person
Analytical

We’d love to hear from people with

Bachelor’s Degree in Financing/Accounting, Business, Supply Chain, Operations, OR equivalent management accounting experience
3 - 5 years of related experience
Distribution Center and Supplier/vendor relationship management experience preferred
Experience using Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and analytical platforms, including but not limited to the ability to analyze data using pivots and V-Lookups.
Experience in understanding process flow and suggest improvements to deliver cost savings, inventory reduction, or other benefits to the site.

What We'll Give You –

Competitive Pay and Bonuses - We’ve created a variety of competitive compensation programs to foster career development, reward success and to show our employees just how much they’re valued.
Financial Planning and wellbeing - No matter what financial goals our employees have set, we want to help them get there. Our plans provide powerful ways to protect income, pay for expenses and invest in the future.
Time away from work - Sometimes we need time away to be with family, focus on our health or just simply recharge. Our plans support our employees’ needs to get out, get healthy and come back stronger than ever.
Extras, discounts and perks - Being a valued member of the Deckers Brands team means more than just a paycheck. From generous discounts to community-based programs, we offer a variety of cool extras
Growth and Development - Deckers Brands was built on the idea of pursuing passion. That’s why we offer extensive opportunities and support for personal and professional development.
Health and Wellness - There’s nothing basic about our comprehensive health and wellness programs and offerings. While at work and at play, we aim to support a healthy lifestyle.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Diversity and inclusion are key to our success. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and our employees are people with different strengths, experiences and backgrounds who share a passion for our brands. We welcome qualified applicants regardless of their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, military or veteran status, mental or physical disability, medical condition and all of the other beautiful parts of your identity.

Job Role Summary

The Senior Strategy Business Analyst provides expertise for moderately to very complex problem solving and complete understanding of system functionality.This position meets with customers on a one-on-one basis to discuss report requirements, visual display, and problem-solve data issues. This position is responsible for the development of requested reports, overall evaluation of data quality and creation of analysis to support the evaluation and decision-making process.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities
Compiles data in the to create reports pulled from multiple data sources
Follows good data management practices to build reports that can be replicated and pulled easily
Delivers an objective point of view to complex business issues based on a deep understanding of data and analytics as well as business principals
Works with a multidisciplinary team to accomplish deliverables
Works directly with customers to analyze and understand their data and needs
Cross-coordinates the design of data collection tools with appropriate clinical and/or business content coordinators to ensure that the data needed to populate reports is being collected within the system
Prepares various reports, surveys and special projects as requested by senior management or for miscellaneous requesting agencies in accordance with departmental procedures
Prepares monthly statistical and financial analysis and reporting packages, which includes but not limited to leadership and directors meeting financial package, departmental dashboards
Job Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Informatics, Business, Mathematics or a healthcare major from an accredited college or university with 2 years analytical experience
In lieu of degree, must have 5 or more years’ experience in business management or project management that focuses on business analysis, preferably in healthcare
Lead or supervisory experience preferred
Expertise developing data reports and analytical summary of data strongly preferred
Valid Indiana driver’s license


Accredited by The Joint Commission and named one of the nation’s 150 best places to work by Becker’s Hospital Review for four consecutive years and Forbes list of best places to work for women, and Forbes list of America’s best midsize employers’ Eskenazi Health’s programs have received national recognition while also offering new health care opportunities to the local community. As the sponsoring hospital for Indianapolis Emergency Medical Services, the city’s primary EMS provider, Eskenazi Health is also home to the first adult Level I trauma center in Indiana, the only verified adult burn center in Indiana, the first community mental health center in Indiana and the Eskenazi Health Center Primary Care – Center of Excellence in Women’s Health, just to name a few.

About The Role

Reporting to the Network Operations Manager, the Business Analyst analyzes financial data, and may produce ad hoc reports as well as monthly, weekly, and daily reports that help leadership make well-informed, strategic decisions for the organization. We are looking for someone who is versed in business strategy and financial concepts as well as knowledgeable with systems and data integrity. The Business Analyst will work closely with capital management, finance, engineering, construction, operations, IT, and others to ensure project requirements are properly communicated.




Responsibilities

Present and analyze data to provide accurate and timely financial recommendations to Network Operations leadership for decision-making purposes
Interpret financial results and drive continuous efforts to identify and implement activities that help the teams’ goals
Evaluate and determine solutions to ensure efficiencies for capital management systems, processes, and reporting
Ensure the information and applications released to various groups are consistent and driven by Frontier's quality objectives and data accuracy
Other duties as assigned

Required Qualifications

Bachelor's Degrees in Business Administration, Information Systems, Information Technology, Finance, or other related fields. Master’s degree is a plus
1-5 years of experience in analytical, strategic, and/or financial roles is a plus
Excellent proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint; proficiency in Power BI, JavaScript, HTML, SQL, and/or Python is a plus
Experience leveraging complex financial modeling with Excel is a plus
Clear communication skills: ability to simply convey complex things to senior audiences
Highly self-motivated; a self-starter, strong intellectual curiosity; creative and investigative mindset
Ability to work independently and in teams, prioritizing multiple projects, issues, and tasks with minimal direction in a dynamic and fast-paced environment with a sense of integrity and urgency for completing tasks

Job Title: IMI CIB - Business Analyst Financial Sponsors Group - New York Branch
Job Description:
Intesa Sanpaolo is the banking group leader in Italy. Assisting more than 14,6 milion of retail customers through a network of 5360 branches, it significantly supports the development of Companies and gives an important sustain to the country's growth. The Group has a selected retail banking presence in Central and Eastern Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, with approximately 1,000 branches and 7.2 million customers in 12 countries. Intesa Sanpaolo is also present in 25 countries in support of its corporate customers’ cross-border business. It is looking for new qualified profiles who want to face demanding and challenging career path with the following requirements:

Scope and Purpose

In support of the Global Relationship Manager (GRM) Financial Sponsors International, the Business Analyst will:

Support the GRM in all tasks related to developing new and expanding existing relationships with Private Equity clients
Perform due diligence on PE clients, fund structures, acquisition targets, industries, and other relevant information as required
Prepare PE and company profiles and pitches
Support in the identification of business opportunities and cross-selling of Intesa Sanpaolo’s financial products and services
Accompany and support the GRM in meeting with clients, in negotiating and structuring transactions
Manage multiple transactions/projects and communicate effectively with deal team members on status and prioritization
Coordinate between and establish strong working partnerships and routines with key internal partners including Leveraged Finance, Fund Finance, Syndication, Debt Capital Markets, Credit, Risk, Industry Verticals, KYC and Legal
Support the preparation of credit applications for LBO and fund finance deals, portfolio summaries and reviews
Perform specific administrative and operative activities related to customer onboarding and management
Demonstrate knowledge of relevant credit policies and procedures and accurately identify policy exceptions
Ensure the Branch’s KYC (Know Your Customers) and CDD (Customers Due Diligence) procedures and directives are adhered to.

The salary range for this job offer would be $ 85,000 - $ 110,000

Required Experience

Ideally 2- 3 years of work experience in a Leveraged Finance, Sponsor Coverage or Capital Markets role
Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
Experience with Bloomberg, SEC filings, rating agency reports, and equity research reports is a plus.

Competencies Required

Good understanding of Leveraged Buyout (“LBO”) transactions and Private Equity (“PE”) fund structures
Knowledge of the Syndicated Loan Market
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to understand and analyze syndicated deal structures and loan documentation
Familiarity with commercial, corporate and investment banking products
Resourceful self-starter, with willingness to learn, superior attention to detail, professional demeanour, and ability to work effectively on multiple projects
Teamwork attitude, with ability to interact and build healthy working relations in a culturally diverse environment
Excellent communication skills
Fluency in English

Required Qualifications, Skills and Knowledge

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration, with an emphasis on Corporate Finance, Financial Accounting or Economics

Job Description:

The NEDSS Base System (NBS) is an integrated information system that helps local, state, and territorial public health departments manage reportable disease data and sends notifiable disease data to the CDC.

The NEDSS Base System (NBS) is an integrated information system that helps local, state, and territorial public health departments manage reportable disease data and sends notifiable disease data to the CDC. The NBS Business Analyst is an integral part of the communicable disease investigation team. This position is responsible for all communication with electronic lab report (ELR) and electronic case report (eCR) data providers, hospitals, laboratories, clinics, the Health Information Exchange (HIE), internal IT staff, and others. The position is also responsible for researching electronic data issues and testing all electronic data received from submitters.

Essential Duties/Responsibilities:

· Work through complex issues that include creating test scenarios, test cases, and test scripts mapped to workflow, and system design requirements.

· Replicate, isolate, and identify a root cause while providing workarounds and testing, fixes, and patches in a staging or test environment.

· Monitor system issues and provide feedback.

· Research and resolve front-end/user and back-end/system problems by diagnosing the root cause, hypothesizing, and mapping out a possible solution, and testing the solution in the QA environment.

· Resolve issues by engaging appropriate business/policy staff, software developers and/or vendor specialists.

· Assist users in monitoring and analyzing their data via SQL querying and reporting.

· Work closely with end users, project management, application developers, and others to understand features and create a robust, comprehensive test strategy to verify functionality.

Myers and Stauffer LC is a certified public accounting and health care reimbursement consulting firm, specializing in audit, accounting, data management and consulting services to government-sponsored health care programs (primarily state Medicaid agencies, and the federal Center for Medicare & Medicaid Services). We have 45+ years of experience assisting our government clients with complex health care reimbursement and provider compliance issues, operate 20 offices and have over 900 associates nationwide.

At Myers and Stauffer, you will have a career that is rewarding while also supporting our state and federal government healthcare clients that focus on those in need. Summary:

The Analyst, Doc Recovery & Corrections under general supervision, the Document (Doc) Recovery and Corrections Analyst is responsible for maintaining agency and/or investor relationship by researching, recovering, and correcting mortgage documents to complete the collateral files per the mandated guidelines to keep in compliance.

Essential Job Functions:

Supports assigned business unit, in monitoring and analyzing required documents to complete agency/investor mandates to meet SLA.
Maintains relationships with business units and investors.
Must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, to relay details between internal and external parties.
Conduct deep document research, as needed, with title companies, county clerks, and/or internal departments.
Ability to use independent judgement to manage and interpret investor guidelines to dispute back, where needed.
Review and compare documents to determine errors, based on agency/investor guidelines.
Facilitate and generate reports based on analysis, to show trends and common themes.
Goal oriented, as well as self-motivated with a sense of professional curiosity, desire to learn new things, and to find/recommend solutions to problems.
Quickly adapts to change and takes proactive approach to problem-solving.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, remain calm in stressful situations, be flexible, work well with many interruptions, and have multi-tasking capabilities.
General office duties, with phone calls outbound/inbound, emails, etc. when following up on recovery of documents.
Assisting with special projects, where applicable
Must exhibit very thorough detail orientation.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance.

Performs other related duties as assigned.

This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

Bachelor's degree in business related field.
Three (3) to four (4) years of mortgage experience with processing documents.
Strong knowledge of Agency guidelines, Ginnie Mae, Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools with strong skills in Excel.
Problem resolution.
Critical thinker.
Business analysis or project knowledge, preferred.
Proficient in Ginnie NET and/or Mortgage Industry Custodian Site Portals, preferred.

Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.

Reasoning Ability:

Ability to carry out detailed written and/or verbal instructions. Ability to solve problems involving concrete variables in standardized situations. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.

Summary:
The Business Intelligence Analyst/ SQL Developer will be responsible for developing reports and dashboards in Microsoft Power BI and writing SQL queries and procedures to support those reports and dashboards. Perform predictive modeling, data analysis, correlation analysis, and regression analysis as required to glean insights from rich patient data

Position Summary:
The Fleet Operations Analyst is a dynamic position responsible for the ongoing oversight of Toyota’s key service and performance indicators as it pertains to targeted fleet customers through our dealer channel. The Fleet Operations Analyst will focus on delivering a uniform experience to strategic customers focused on superior productivity, and increased safety and optimized uptime by leveraging telemetry data and the Toyota dealer channel.

The Fleet Operations Analyst role is responsible to leverage technology to increase operational efficiency. Additionally, the Fleet Operations Analyst is responsible for new system development and project implementations to support business development and kaizen requirements.

Consistently demonstrate the practice of Toyota Core Values behaviors to ensure customer experience, focus and satisfaction. Demonstrate acuity in people management (internal, vendors, customers and other stake holders) to influence results.

Essential Position Duties:

Develop competence in Toyota Business process
Oversee the daily operating performance status of targeted customers
Develop, track and maintain targeted performance KPIs (internal and external)
Communicate and coordinate with dealers to achieve targeted performance KPIs (internal and external)
Advise and assist dealers and customers on the utilization of Fleet and Telematics tools and data to achieve targeted performance KPIs
Use existing procedures to review and solve problems using standardization and develop controls/automation as needed
Act as liaison between dealers and customers for any service discrepancies
Train dealers on best practices needed to meet customer expectations
Contribute to customer business reviews and provide insights
Develop knowledge about each customer’s business model and requirements.
Pioneer process improvement projects within the department
Maintain competent understanding of company’s products, their functions and alternatives
Coordinate, analyze and improve customer service functions to meet company goals
Ability to work in a constant state of alertness and safe manner
Execute daily work with frequent instruction, guidance and direction of manager
Additional duties as assigned
Recommend customer improvement plans, test methods, and standard operating procedures
Conduct sample size determination, statistical analysis, root cause analysis and applicable training

Bachelor Degree
Customer focused
Technical aptitude
Ability to work and research data
Proficient problem solving
Cross Functional Teamwork
Proficient oral and written communicator
Result oriented

Department Information



VPSS Financial Aid is dedicated to supporting the campus financial aid offices so that they may better serve students. We do this by maintaining and configuring the SIS for accurate awarding and disbursing of nearly $1B of student aid annually, managing daily application and award data exchange between IU and a multitude of federal and state entities; providing interpretation of state and federal regulations and rules to ensure business operations, policies and procedures are in compliance; updating and reconciling student financial aid awards as needed throughout the year; developing and maintaining reports and documentation to support business processes executed by the campuses along with identifying business process improvements and opportunities for increased efficiency; troubleshooting SIS issues and providing all tiers of financial aid Help Desk support; providing ad hoc reporting and analysis; providing leadership and central administration of a shared, online vended system (Blackbaud Award Management) for awarding institutional scholarships; evaluating academic progress of aid applicants in accordance with federal rules and institutional policies; and proactively identifying and resolving student loan issues to expedite students receipt of funds.

Job Summary



The Office of the Vice President for Student Success, division of Financial Aid is seeking a Financial Aid Business Analyst with a software focus to support our SIS business processes, operating systems and the operational data processing needs for the division.

Department Specific Responsibilities

Designs and develops data structures and programs to generate FA system-wide reports and queries using a variety of institutional SIS data files and tables.

Conducts experienced assessments to understand client business needs and strategic direction and identifies technology solutions to achieve goals; consults with IT staff and business users to identify, analyze, refine and document business requirements and processes and develop associated solutions.

Provides stakeholders with necessary analysis documentation for buy-in, leadership decision, and implementation; conducts walk-throughs of recommended system functionality and prototypes with business users in small group or large group settings.
Ensures uniform documentation presentation and content structure including, but not limited to, online documentation.
Develops test plans and conducts system/integration testing; can test changes, enhancements, and new programs or functions to ensure they meet business needs.

The Purpose of the Business Analyst is to work closely with the Product Manager, Quality Assurance, Software Architects, and Development teams to produce quality software that meets our client needs. The Business Analyst will manage the requirements process and will serve as the liaison between the Product Manager and the Technology teams. You will be responsible to identify, assess, and document business requirements, recommending business priorities, and advising business on options, risks, and costs. Conduct research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within or outside the business, and if not, whether new solutions are feasible. Analyze impact of proposed solution across the business, develop use cases to explain/demonstrate business requirements/specifications to team, and contribute a business or process perspective during design reviews. Assist quality assurance team to ensure that requirements documentation can be easily translated into test plans, and ensure that the proper testing plans have been completed. Facilitate implementation of new functionality through training sessions, demos, and the development of appropriate documentation. Provide relevant test scenarios for the quality assurance team. Work with quality assurance team to develop system integration test scripts and ensure the testing results correspond to the business expectations.

Essential Functions

Lead functional design portion of SDLC process including: Leading functional design meetings, writing design documents, coordinating the review process.
Act as Liaison between business and technology teams in order to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate requirements,
Constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications; use cases and scenarios
Hold responsibility for troubleshooting and filtering product development issues including bugs, configuration and documentation discrepancies.
Maintain communication channels with clients during collaborative development efforts.
Review feature 'Ideas' from internal and external sources then escalate those features internally, for future development.
Work across product teams to develop features and solutions to increase efficiency and productivity for our financial institution clients
Work closely across departments & with customers to build system features that impact daily financial institution operations.
Improve systems by studying current practices; designing modifications.
Recommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures.
Provide support to clients as necessary
Provide support to internal teams as necessary
Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.
Review Production Documentation for accuracy
Review test cases for accuracy
Communicate with other departments to coordinate test and deployment activities

Requirements

BA or BS Business, Management, Computer Science, or other related degrees
3+ years Experience Business Analyst
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Knowledge of Bank commercial loan systems
Ability to assimilate, organize and summarize large amounts of information
Strong knowledge of Business Analysis techniques and processes
Strong negotiation skills with ability to find successful resolutions to complex issues
Proactive with a strong sense of accountability
Ability to work both independently and as part of a close team depending upon project
Highly motivated and self-directed
Strong analytical skills and writing skills, to include solid experience in writing functional and technical specifications
Proven ability to work closely with the business and translate business needs into functional specifications for technology.
Excellent problem solving skills
Advanced skill level in SDLC processes using both waterfall & agile methodologies.
Strong ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize work efforts in a demanding high paced environment.

We are seeking a skilled Operations Analyst Markle Indiana plant operations team. The primary focus of this role is to generate and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure operational effectiveness. Must be a LOCAL applicant.

The Operations Analyst will play a vital role in providing meaningful insights to the business, utilizing data modeling and visualization techniques to communicate the story. This role is responsible for analyzing and evaluating various aspects of the sort, including inventory control, order fulfillment, labor utilization, and overall process improvement.

The Operations Analyst uses data-driven insights to identify opportunities for optimization, implement solutions, and drive continuous improvement initiatives within the sort environment.

Essential Functions:

· Generate and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure business performance: Develop and maintain a comprehensive set of KPIs to measure operational effectiveness and efficiency in the sort environment.

· Provide meaningful insights: Collect and analyze data related to sort operations, including inventory levels, order volumes, picking and packing efficiency, and labor utilization. Identify patterns, trends, and areas for improvement based on data analysis, and provide regular updates and insights to business stakeholders

· Process Evaluation: Evaluate existing sorting processes and workflows to identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas of improvement. Conduct time and motion studies, analyze order processing workflows, process mapping, and root cause analysis to identify opportunities for optimization. Identify opportunities to improve processing time, improve sort accuracy, and enhance stakeholder satisfaction.

· ERP systems: Leverage expertise in ERP systems to extract and analyze data, identifying trends and areas for optimization.

· Reporting and Communication: Prepare regular reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate insights and recommendations to management and stakeholders. Present findings, progress, and improvement initiatives in meetings.

· Data modeling and visualization: Utilize data modeling techniques and advanced Excel skills to create models, charts, and graphs that effectively communicate complex data sets to business stakeholders.

· Training and Support: Provide training and support to plant staff on process changes, system updates, and best practices. Ensure that team members understand and adhere to standard operating procedures (SOPs) and safety guidelines.

· Data integrity maintenance: Ensure the accuracy, completeness, and consistency of data by implementing quality control measures and data validation techniques.

· Cross-functional collaboration: Collaborate with various teams such as operations, engineering, management and stakeholders to gather data, understand requirements, and develop solutions for operational challenges.

· Profit-minded approach: Identify opportunities for cost reduction and operational efficiency improvements through data analysis and collaborate with relevant stakeholders to implement appropriate measures. Apply a profit-minded mindset to all analyses and decision-making, focusing on improving financial performance and contributing to overall business profitability.

Skills and Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s degree in operations management, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field; applicable experience in lieu of degree.

· Proven experience as an Operations Analyst or in a similar analytical role.

· Prior experience in a data driven environment is preferred.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.

· Proficiency in data analysis tools, techniques, and software, including advanced Excel functions and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).

· Familiarity with ERP systems and their data structures.

· Flexibility and initiative related to completing tasks.

· Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.

· Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and integrity.

· Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to work on multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.

· Continuous learning mindset to stay updated with industry trends and emerging analytics techniques.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

Education: Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration (MBA), Finance/Accounting, Computer Science, Engineering, Technology, or similar

Experience: 4-7 years as an IT Business Analyst or similar role.

Skills needed:

Excellent communication skills

Should be able to work with little or no supervision

Should be able to work in a team environment

Should have a very good understanding of each phase of the SDLC

Should be able to gather requirements unambiguously

Should be able to create user stories and enter them in JIRA

Should be able to perform gap analysis (As-Is & To-Be) and create simple to complex BPMs using MS Visio or any other tools

Should be able to create UML digrams

Technical Writing: Should be able to create/write professional BRD, FRD, User Stories, Use Case Document and other project documentation.

QA Testing: Should be able work with the QA team and involved in testing and UAT

Should have experience working in both Waterfall and Agile-Scrum se-ups

In this role, you will provide business intelligence services through BI software development, and create BI reports and tools from raw data. You will participate in cross-functional teams and will require strong relationships internally and externally with a focus on continuous process improvement generation. This role reports into the Senior Director of Central Distribution Center (CDC) Operations.

Who we want

Self-directed initiators - People who take ownership of their work and need no prompting to drive productivity, change, and outcomes.

Strategic thinkers - People who enjoy analyzing data or trends for the purposes of planning, forecasting, advising, budgeting, reporting, cost control or sales opportunities.

The Business Process Analyst will be responsible for ensuring business processes and supporting systems continue to meet business project stakeholder needs. This position is a key liaison between Clinical, Operational, IT and Analytics staff that implements business process management technology (BPMT) based solutions and the line-of-business staff that performs the process work. Business Process Analyst must be able to straddle the IT, Analytics and Business domains and communicate (or broker communications) between each side. This Analyst is a hands-on worker who will drive the creation of process models (primarily conceptual/logical level models, often using business process analysis [BPA] tools) and work with others to provide the supporting process ecosystem and implementations (including screen interactions, dashboards, rule management and optimization algorithms). This position deals with the more tactical, day-to-day aspects of discovering, validating, documenting, and communicating business-process-related knowledge through modeling, simulating, and analyzing current and future states. The Business Process Analyst supports the business process owner, enabling them to make better decisions about changing processes to drive higher performance outcomes consistently.

Position Title: Technical Business Analyst

Safety Sensitive: No

Supervisor’s Title: Director of PMO

FLSA Status: Exempt

Department: Information Technology

Division: PMO


POSITION PURPOSE

The Technical Business Analyst role will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, documenting, and communicating project requirements. This role will also be responsible for product testing, monitoring and continuously refining the quality strategy, conducting root cause analysis for problem resolution, and heavily assisting in deriving the best solution and returning the most effective desired result. This role will be a key member of the IndyGo Project Management Office (PMO) and work closely with the IndyGo IT Team, various business units, and members of the IndyGo Executive Team. The ideal candidate will be goal-motivated and resourceful, with keen problem-solving and effective communication skills.


The salary range is $80,000 - $85,000 annually, commensurate with education and experience.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

To be successful in this role, an individual must be able to perform in a satisfactory manner the functions listed below. The company will make reasonable accommodations to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these functions.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Lead and/or participate in requirements gathering and analysis sessions to determine project requirements.
Analyze business needs, document requirements, manage plans, and provide recommendations to improve business functionality.
Work with internal and/or external customers to resolve issues with existing business applications, systems, or processes and recommend alternative solutions to meet user needs.
Perform cost-benefit analysis and feasibility studies within the duties of the PMO.
Assist in developing and managing detailed projects, monitoring activities, and analyzing, implementing, and solving routine to moderately complex problems for one or more functional business areas.
Assist in evaluating proposals for data collection by understanding the functional areas, business, and application needs.
Anticipate and document issues/risks and manage stakeholder expectations about the solution requirements.
Accountable for reviewing and finalizing extensive functional and technical documentation.
Analyze specified requirements while observing gaps, ensuring clear acceptance criteria.
Engage with project stakeholders to understand business needs, formulating a strategy for achieving the necessary level of quality while ensuring the plan aligns with IndyGo’s delivery process and customer needs.
Participate in formulating and organizing acceptance and systematic regression testing with stakeholders for feature and requirement validation, effectively identifying issues, causes, and resolutions throughout the project lifecycle.


OTHER FUNCTIONS

Performs other duties as assigned.


SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

None


EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE

To perform this job successfully, an individual must have the following education and/or experience.

A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution or a combination of relevant education and experience.
A minimum of six (6) years of experience working on medium-to-large complex Enterprise Programs/initiatives as a Business Analyst.
Experience as a Business Analyst in Information Technology fields is a plus.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The company will make reasonable accommodations to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these functions.

Experience conducting user workshops, focus group sessions, and other collaborative techniques.
Demonstrate the ability to deliver on project commitments through leadership, teamwork, problem analysis/resolution, and productivity improvements.
Effective time management and prioritization skills.
Ability to construct quality deliverables from minimal definitions and to work on multiple assignments simultaneously.
Ability to communicate clearly and convey complex business and technical information blends to various audiences.
Expert knowledge of collaboration tools (SharePoint/Zoom/WebEx/MS Teams).
Demonstrate the capability to build and maintain lasting Business and IT relationships.
Ability to work with (and lead from within) global and cross-functional teams.
Experience with project management methodologies such as Agile and Waterfall.


PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described here are representative of those an individual must meet to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. The company will make reasonable accommodations to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these functions.

Ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to remain stationary for long periods of time, to position oneself to work in low and/or confined spaces, and to move throughout the workday occasionally between departments and facilities.
Ability to work in a deadline-oriented office environment.
Local travel is required occasionally.

At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.

Organization Overview:

Lilly is entering an exciting period of growth and we are committed to delivering innovative medicines to patients around the world. Lilly is investing over $300 Million to create a new state-of-the-art manufacturing site for Gene Therapy, in Lebanon, Indiana. The brand-new facility will utilize the latest technology for Gene Therapy Manufacturing and Technology. This is an exciting once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to help build and operate a new site. The Lilly Lebanon API Manufacturing site will be built using the latest high-tech equipment, advanced highly integrated and automated manufacturing systems, and have a focus on minimizing the impact to our environment. This is an opportunity you don’t want to miss!

Manufacturing and Quality Tech@Lilly supports manufacturing operational excellence and productivity efforts through utilization of information and technology. MQ Tech@Lilly strives to enable the making of medicine “with safety first and quality always”

Responsibility:

This MQ Tech@Lilly Analyst (Laboratory Business Integrator) position at Lebanon API Manufacturing will partner with the quality control functional area and global Tech@Lilly teams to implement and support digital laboratory solutions to support the organizational objectives of the Lebanon API Manufacturing site. Responsibilities will involve interacting with global Tech@Lilly and local site support functions to configure systems and assist with installing and qualifying laboratory IT systems such as LIMS/LES (LabVantage, MODA), ELN (NuGenesis), and other lab systems (Empower, WinKQCL). The role will evolve into monitoring, execution, maintenance, and continuous improvement of the Laboratory IT Systems for the QC lab with an emphasis on continuous improvement, especially with regard to data integrity. This role will serve as a representative for laboratory IT systems and will be responsible for mentoring and educating peers on the use of lab systems, supporting audits, and oversight for management reviews, laboratory metrics, laboratory equipment, and laboratory documentation.

Key Objectives/Deliverables:

Expand the laboratory systems stack knowledge and understand local laboratory procedures.
Support and configure laboratory equipment inside LIMS/LES (LabVantage, MODA), ELN (NuGenesis), and other lab systems (Empower, WinKQCL)to ensure correct execution of laboratory testing
Assists site deployment and upgrade of QC laboratory IT systems such as MODA, Empower, NuGenesis, and LabVantage
Accurately translate business processes into technical terms and vice versa
Build and maintain awareness and knowledge of regulatory, legal, or quality requirements impacting the quality control laboratory, and ensure that solution requirements comply
Deliver and support laboratory systems stack to start up new quality control lab operations inside the Lebanon API Manufacturing site
Work with global system teams to ensure operational readiness of laboratory systems to support the operational objectives of the LP2 facility (i.e. validation plans, standard operating procedures, training, etc.)
Produce and maintain project and validation documentation
Ensure systems remain in a validated state and manage their lifecycle through releases, recapitalization, and retirement
Ensure the incident, problem, configuration, and change/release management are all accomplished in alignment with and understanding of business needs
Partners and builds relationships with Global Quality Laboratory Network, Global and Site team members
Acts as Tech@Lilly key contact SME for QC laboratory IT systems
Develops training materials

Basic Requirements:

Bachelor of Science degree in IT, Chemistry, Pharmacy, Science, Engineering, or related field
At least 1 year of relevant work experience in information technology, engineering, computer system validation, quality control support or related areas

Additional Skills/Preferences:

Prior work experience working in pharma or other GMP setting
Strong working knowledge of quality control laboratory Tech@Lilly systems (i.e. Empower, Lab Vantage, etc.).
Solid knowledge of Computer System Validation process
Demonstrated ability to analyze, anticipate, and resolve complex issues (technical, operational, or business-related) through sound problem-solving skills
Effectively prioritize and escalate issues
Demonstrated learning agility and curiosity
Demonstrated ability to understand quality control business processes and convert into IT requirements/solutions
Desire and ability to communicate using a variety of methods in diverse forums

A recognized leader in the death care industry in North America, our focus lies in delivering meaningful solutions to help families honor the lives of those they love®. We are currently seeking a Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence to join our team.

Your Role at Batesville:

As a Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence, you will be responsible for leading the data analysis center of excellence. This role will play a crucial role in driving data-driven decision-making within the organization. You will be responsible for collecting, analyzing., and transforming data into actionable insights that will enable our company to make informed strategic and operational decisions.

How You’ll be Rewarded:

Batesville is a family. You will be part of a family of highly committed associates who are passionate about our company, committed to our customers and excited about our future.
Competitive pay.
IMMEDIATE ELIGIBILITY – Comprehensive medical, dental and vision insurance, as well as prescription coverage, short-term disability, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), and more.
Generous 401K Matching Program
Paid time off.
Opportunities for development and advancement.

What You’ll Do:

Data Collection & Analysis: Gather, clean, and validate data from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets, and external data providers. Perform in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and outliers. Develop and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes to ensure data accuracy and availability.
Report Generation & Visualization: Create clear and concise reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to communicate key insights to stakeholders. Utilized BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or similar) to design and develop interactive dashboards. Provide regular and ad-hoc reports to support decision-making across the organization.
Data Modeling & Forecasting: Build predictive and prescriptive models to forecast future trends, identify opportunities and mitigate risks. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and refine forecasting models based on business needs.
Business Insights: Collaborate closely with business leaders to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights to drive strategic initiatives. Conduct deep-dive analyses to answer specific business questions and provide data-driven recommendations.
Data Governance & Quality Assurance: Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency by implementing data quality standards and governance practices. Develop and maintain documentation for data sources, definitions, and transformations.
Continuous Improvement: Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in business intelligence and analytics.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with teams across the organization, including Marketing, Sales, Finance & Operations, to gather data requirements and deliver insights.
Other duties may be assigned.

What You’ll Bring:

Employee must be able to travel 10% of the time.
Bachelor’s degree (B.S./B.A.) or equivalent from a college or university in statistics, data science, finance, or related field; and a minimum of 3 years related data analytics experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience with an emphasis in data analytics.

Nice to Haves:

Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret financial data and trends.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain financial information to non-financial.
Strong team collaboration skills.
Intellectual curiosity and natural inquisitiveness.

Overview :
The Business Process Analyst will conduct data analysis to improve our supply chain operations, which is the optimization of our facility and capabilities, including distribution center, and customer orders, as well as the transportation and communications links between them. The main goal of the job is to help our company to increase efficiency and reduce costs, while exceeding customer expectations. A large component of this will include an emphasis on technology gains. This role will be directly involved in developing, monitoring, and analyzing integrations and solutions between applicable platforms. In this role, the analyst should have an analytical mind and a strong business acumen. Critical thinking skills and attention to detail are essential.
Responsibilities:
Track KPIs and report on supply chains performance.

Job Description

General Dynamics Information Technology (GDIT) has an opening for a Senior Business Process Analyst who will serve as a member of Business Operations' IT Governance and Process Team, within Global Chief Information Officer (GCIO) Services.

The Senior Business Process Analyst will also serve as a focal point for the administration of controlled documents across GCIO Services, in order to help drive GDIT’s strategy and vision, minimize risk, increase employee efficiency and effectiveness, and ensure GDIT’s corporate objectives are met.


HOW YOU WILL MAKE AN IMPACT:

Willingness to work additional hours periodically when required to meet deadlines

Ability to foster, and maintain positive, collaborative relationships with GCIO Services and GDIT team members and management

The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for partnering with subject matter experts in Supply Chain, Manufacturing and Warehouse Management to gather business requirements. The Senior Business Analyst will identify gaps between business processes and D365 F&O. The Senior Business Analyst will use their knowledge and expertise of D365 F&O to create process flows and functional design documents that define solutions that meet business needs. The Senior Business Analyst will apply proven communication, analytic and problem-solving skills ensuring alignment with IT and overall business strategies. The Senior Business Analyst formulates and recommends solutions that can be applied globally and aligns D365 for Finance and Operations functionality with Allegion’s Ordering, Manufacturing, Supply Chain and Warehouse Management business processes.

Provide D365 ERP support with complex business requirements and challenges requiring a deep expertise in Supply Chain, Manufacturing and Warehouse Management

Actively support rapid and continuous improvement events by providing a combined view of business and system processes
Train new D365 F&O Business Analysts and Business Analyst contractors on standard work
Train users on system functionality
Assist users with SOP creation

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business, Information Technology or related field
5+ years of proven experience within large manufacturing (multi-national) or distribution operations
5+ years of experience working with Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations ERP or AX2012 – with heavy emphasis in Manufacturing, Warehouse Management and Supply Chain-related business activities
Experience with supporting major D365 F&O ERP upgrades and/or implementations
Experience developing comprehensive business requirements, functional design documents, completing impact assessments, and contributing to business cases that identify value of the change
Ability to work independently as well as to collaborate effectively with others in person and remotely
Excellent communication skills with all levels. Proven ability to lead and communicate orally, in written documents, and in formal presentations is required.
Team player, change agent, and customer-driven mentality
Analytical approach to problem-solving, solid conceptual skills and willingness to learn, sense of urgency and commitment for a job well done.
Strong work ethic, results oriented

Solid understanding of data integrity and audit / compliance procedures
