Comfortable using SQL and other tools to work with data for ad hoc analysis

The Salvation Army Mission Statement:

The Salvation Army, an international movement, is an evangelical part of the universal Christian church. Its message is based on the Bible. Its ministry is motivated by the love of God. Its mission is to preach the gospel of Jesus Christ and to meet human needs in His name without discrimination.

Job Overview:

As the Business Systems Administrator, you will be responsible for managing implementation and use of all operational business systems and develops appropriate operating procedures to ensure efficient utilization to ensure the Mission of The Salvation Army is effectively carried out.

What You Will Do:

· Provides technical support and training for all Office 365 systems and coordinates center-wide usage structure and procedures.

· Manages strategic business technology solutions for Kroc Center operations to allow for timely and efficient extraction of relevant data in support of strategic decisions by Kroc leadership.

· Drives system and process improvements to reduce manual tracking systems and utilizes database functionality to auto populate routine functions and information pulls.

· Oversees implementation of new operational technology systems to assure smooth transition and effective integration with other systems.

· Responsible for accurate, complete and timely entry of data into the Point-of-Sale system.

· Serves as the chief resource for business process questions and provides specific and general information as required.

· Provides regular and on-going training opportunities for Kroc staff to expand their knowledge and capabilities of business systems used in the Kroc Center.

· Is responsible to administer licensing and renewals of business process software programs. Tracks renewal timing and projections for budgeting and planning use.

· Researches, compiles, interprets, and summarizes information for statistics, various reports, spreadsheets, surveys, and special projects. Researches files, accounts, records, etc. to resolve problems and/or correct documented information; informs appropriate individuals of discoveries.

· Provides recommendations to leadership which will improve/simplify/stream-line methods and procedures; initiates, explains, and enforces new and existing procedures as directed.

· Creates and maintains Standard Operating Procedures for business technology systems as directed.

· Coordinates regularly with the Technology Administrator to assure streamlined systems and an up-to-date inventory of all relevant items.

· Act as the Technology resource and coordinating point in the absence of the Technology Administrator.

· Provide as needed support outside of normal work hours for critical system support and system maintenance. Schedule will be flexible and will include some evening and weekend hours.

Other tasks as assigned by leadership

1. Ability to concentrate and pay close attention to detail for extended periods of time when reading and preparing reports or resolving operational problems.

2. Excellent communication skills including interpersonal skills, tack & diplomacy. English proficiency required and Spanish language skills helpful.

3. Strong analytical and organizational skills.

4. Exceptional flexibility and ability to work on multiple projects or tasks simultaneously.

5. Ability to collaborate and work within a team and maintain effective working relationships.

6. Intermediate to advanced skill with Microsoft 365 Applications and cloud-based storage & sharing solutions; ability to access payroll, timekeeping and personal data via a web-based system.

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.

When you are part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.

Discover Impactful Work:

How will you make an impact?

The Sales Operations Analyst will partner with the Sales Operations team to ensure the tactical execution of initiatives and projects to drive the sales organization towards meeting the criteria for success within the defined sales strategies and objectives. The ideal candidate will have strong business acumen, combined with excellent analytical skills and a bias toward action and collaboration. Strong process orientation and the ability to communicate, collaborate and influence team members in a cross functional environment are also required. This opportunity allows the individual in this role to develop their career in a challenging yet visible role.

A day in the Life:

What will you do?

Responsible for the support of sales incentive compensation within the scope of the North American LPD field sales teams. This includes but is not limited to:
Involvement in sales compensation plan design for all members of the Sales teams that are eligible under the Sales Incentive Plans (SIP).
Working with the Sales Operations team - review monthly incentive compensation payouts and casework (credit adjustments).
Support the Sales and Sales Operations teams with the month end reporting and incentive compensation process. This includes but is not limited to the month end reports for the Sales teams as well as preparing compensation data for review and approval by the Sr. Manager, Sales Operations for incentive compensation.
Support Sr. Manager, Sales Operations in quota setting for North American Sales organization for teams in scope of responsibility
Responsible for data quality and maintenance, by reviewing and updating product key assignments in the Data Warehouse and Xactly Incent (incentive compensation management software).
Responsible for special projects that support the strategic initiatives of the North American Sales Organization.
Ownership of the Sales Rep Product/Channel responsibility matrix. This role will have complete understanding of all the products and sales channels that the various sales teams in the North American organization are responsible for. This includes the complete documentation and change management of this matrix to support the sales strategies of the organization.
Support of the Sales Territory Management process. This includes support of the sales organization with territory mapping; deriving tools and documentation that articulates the mapping to the Sales Organization.
Provide ad-hoc reporting as requested by the members of Sales Operations and Sales teams.
Provide input and insight into commercial discussion as a full-standing member of Commercial and Sales Operations teams.

Experience
3 - 5 years of experience in Sales Operations, Commercial Support, or related Finance role

Minimum of 3+ years of progressively responsible business experience
Strong knowledge of Excel (i.e., financial models and analysis), Cognos reporting tool (or equivalent), Xactly ICM Tool, PowerPoint, is preferred

The successful candidate is personable, highly ethical and thrives in a collaborative environment.
Exhibits always: personal accountability to accuracy of information and deadlines
Proactive communication capabilities, identifying and addressing issues via candid dialogue and transparency
Must operate effectively in a complexly matrixed organization, having a track record of developing high levels of credibility and forging solid and positive professional relationships with peers and upper management
Strong commercial orientation with demonstrated experience partnering with business leaders to drive growth
Exceptional analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills
Self-motivated with high bias for action and accountability
High level of energy; will bring a passion to excel. Able to energize and influence a wide spectrum of people, including senior financial, commercial and operations professionals.

Drives a culture of accountability

First Databank (FDB) is seeking a Commercial Business Systems Analyst. The Commercial Business Systemts Analyst will work with business partners to identify, define and clarify scope of problems and issues. This individual will also serve as a point of escalation for governance and data quality and have responsibility for improving the quality and ensuring the integrity of critical customer and prospect-related data and information assets.

The Commercial Business Systems Analyst should thrive on solving complex problems and developing innovative solutions related to Salesforce, Gainsight and Mulesoft while striving for OOTB solutions and articulating the pros/cons of customizations.

Position will be based out of our Indianapolis, IN office.

Responsibilities:

Serve as a Salesforce and Gainsight SME and help drive salesforce requirements and changes to enhance our sales process efficiency and standardization of processes.
Establish and govern an enterprise data governance implementation roadmap including strategic priorities.
Develop and implement a formal plan to establish a baseline, improve, and maintain data quality.
Define roles and responsibilities related to data governance and ensure clear accountability for stewardship of the commercial team’s principal information assets.
Serve as a liaison between commercial team, finance, IT and other areas to ensure that data related business requirements for ensuring data integrity are clearly defined, communicated, and well understood and considered as part of operational prioritization and planning.
Work with business systems personnel on issues related to software applications that utilize and rely on commercial team data.
Coordinate external data sources to eliminate redundancy and streamline the expense related to those services.
Create rules and procedures for data sharing and quality control.
Evaluate design of existing business processes & systems to judge their functionality, effectiveness, reliability, performance, usage, maintainability
Support the Systems Analyst in overseeing defects, aligning processes with technical solutions and resolving issues.

Assist with development and maintenance of field reports/dashboards using either SFDC report builder, Wave or other BI tools available.

Strong knowledge of Salesforce.com platform is required
Experience with Gainsight, Ringlead (or related data management software), PowerBi and other business intelligence tools and platforms.
Self-sufficient, flexible, and motivated team player capable of managing several activities simultaneously
Excellent communication skills are critical
Ability to analyze business processes, design process improvements, and train business users on the new processes
Excellent writing skills. Must have the ability to express strategy, technical knowledge, and processes in easily understood presentations
Experience in the healthcare, pharma or medical device industry a plus

Required Experience:

At least 5 years of experience working in a Business Analyst position
At least 3 years of experience working on projects related to Commercial/Sales process improvement
Applicant is actively working with SFDC in current position or has done so in a recent position. Certification in SFDC administration and/or development a plus.
Applicant has worked in a business analyst role supporting commercial functions
Strong knowledge of Salesforce.com concepts including standard objects structure, workflows, reporting, general design concepts and overall approach of Salesforce.com as a CRM platform

POSITION OVERVIEW:

The position of operations analyst at Winthrop Capital Management (WCM) is an entry level position designed to provide candidates with a challenging, meaningful and supportive opportunity to build a career in the investment management business.

The position requires a disciplined, organized, and engaged individual who can contribute positively to our culture in a team-oriented environment. The successful candidate should have the ability to contribute in a positive manner to our culture by operating consistently within established processes, holding oneself accountable, and seeking to continually learn.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Assist in the maintenance of asset allocation models and portfolio structures.

· Assist in the design and testing of Winthrop Technology Solution’s proprietary portfolio and risk analytic software called Wombat.

- Analyze performance and risk attributes of portfolio total return

- Detailed analysis of duration and yield calculations for securities in portfolios

· Review portfolio compliance relative to compliance rules for each account

· Responsible for automating and testing the batch reporting system for client portfolios

· Reconcile performance numbers on a monthly basis across 500 accounts between the current performance measurement system and our proprietary performance analytics system called Wombat.

· Update security and portfolio analytics.

· Maintain risk models for portfolios.

· Support the Chief Compliance Officer with producing documentation for the registered investment company’s quarterly compliance with Securities Exchange Commission rules.

· Provide support to portfolio managers and analysts as needed.

· Assist in quarterly client reporting process.

SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:

· 1-3 years of experience in the investment industry

· Possession of bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, accounting, or business

· Solid mathematics and quantitative skills

· Exceptional organizational skills

· Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word

· Desire to pursue CFA

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Winthrop Capital Management was founded in 2007. We implement value-oriented investment strategies in both equity and fixed income portfolios and serve both institutional and individual investors. Our goal is to provide outstanding long-term investment performance results consistent with the risk tolerance and investment constraints of each client. We seek to provide the highest level of service to our clients to help them achieve their investment objectives.

Winthrop Capital Management – 10201 N. Illinois Street, Suite 275 Carmel, IN 46290

To apply, please send an updated, resume to:

Gregory Hahn

10201 N. Illinois Street, Suite 275

Carmel, IN 46290

Or send via email toadmin@winthropcm.comAll resumes are considered confidential.

Winthrop Capital Management is an equal opportunity employer.

WCM MISSION

Our goal is to help our clients achieve successful financial outcomes in relation to their specific Investment Management objectives. To accomplish this, we focus on long-term goals and create solutions that will realistically help clients achieve those goals with minimum risk.

COMPANY VALUES

Winthrop Capital Management holds itself to the following Values:

Character and Integrity define the person

Our Culture and Firm come before the individual Always do the right thing for the client

Make a positive impact in someone's life every day

THE WCM CULTURE:

Winthrop Capital Management describes its culture in the following way:

We recognize that it is important for our clients to speak into all aspects of our firm.

We recognize the need to over-communicate in order to create transparency within WCM.

We seek to question and analyze to get to the truth rather than accept what is provided at face value. We believe accountability rests with a person - not a committee.

We believe the value of a meeting is a function of the work that is done between the meetings.

We empower the employee to take the initiative to make thoughtful decisions that benefit the company and the client.

We are lifetime learners and recognize that we need to continue to learn in order to continue to grow. We hold each other accountable for our actions and initiatives.

Every employee strives for excellence in all that he/she does both within the firm and for our clients. We take responsibility for our actions and will take initiative on behalf of the company and our clients.

We recognize that we are all individuals and we respect each other for our differences, and encourage the continued development of each other’s gifts.

Company Overview:
Axia Technology Partners (AxiaTP) empowers organizations in all industries to achieve operational excellence through managed IT services, unified communications and custom software solutions. AxiaTP was founded in 2008. Now a member of the Group 1001 family of companies, our team is a fast-growing Complete Technology Provider.
Group 1001, and its affiliated companies, is strongly committed to providing a supportive work environment where employee differences are valued. Diversity is an essential ingredient in making Group 1001 a welcoming place to work and is fundamental in building a high-performance team. Diversity embodies all the differences that make us unique individuals. All employees share the responsibility for maintaining a workplace culture of dignity, respect, understanding and appreciation of individual and group differences.
AxiaTP
Founded in 2008, AxiaTP started as a small telecommunications company in Indianapolis. More than a decade later, we’ve grown into a Complete Technology Provider, ready to bring value to businesses of all sizes with innovative IT solutions. Our team has more than 30 years of combined experience in helping businesses small and large across various industries. AxiaTP is a member of Group1001, whose team combines fresh thinking and a can-do culture with insurance, technology, and investment management expertise to make a real difference in people’s lives. Here, we take a human approach to technology.
What does that mean? Simply put, technology doesn’t have to be hard! Our team of experts aren’t here to overwhelm you with technical jargon; we’re here to make IT easy, and make it work for you.

Working collaboratively with the client’s business team to assess business processes and elicit business requirements
Identifying and documenting needed business process improvements and functional requirements
Partnering with AxiaTP’s development team to design solution recommendations to deliver business process improvements
Supporting solution implementation and user acceptance testing
Maintaining open communication with AxiaTP and client project management

Knowledge, including Business acumen, industry, organizational, methodology

Interaction Skills, including teamwork, facilitation, leadership and influence, negotiation, conflict resolution, teaching
Software and Tools, including Microsoft Office suite, MS Visio, BPM Notation preferred, SharePoint, Azure Dev Ops

Strong consideration will be given to candidates with a background and/or experience in computer science, finance, accounting, information technology, or business administration.
The ideal candidate should have an enthusiasm for team collaboration a passion for using technology to solve problems and fulfill business outcomes
Must demonstrate ability to promote an inclusive environment that reflects the broad diversity and backgrounds represented by our Clients and Team Members and which every individual feels respected and valued
Confident in making decisions, accurate, detailed-oriented and able to problem solve/analyze

Excellent communication skills to include internal/external interaction, and documentation (samples of nonproprietary documentation maybe be asked for review)

Responsible for analyzing, reporting, and developing recommendations on data related to complex and varied business metrics. Typically provides technical assistance to clinical or non-technical associates.

How you will make an impact:

Creates and maintains databases to track business performance.

Analyzes data and summarizes performance using summary statistical procedures.

Develops and analyzes business performance reports (e.g., for claims data, provider data, utilization data) and provides notations of performance deviations and anomalies.

Creates and publishes periodic reports, as well as any necessary ad hoc reports.

May require taking business issue and devising best way to develop appropriate diagnostic and/or tracking data that will translate business requirements into usable decision support tools.

May make recommendations based upon data analysis.

Minimum Requirements:

Requires a BS/BA degree in related field and a minimum of 3 years data analysis in a healthcare setting or related experience; or any combination of education and experience which would provide an equivalent background.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with relational databases and knowledge of query tools and statistical software is strongly preferred, including SQL data pulls.

Ability to manipulate large sets of data is strongly preferred.

Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills are strongly preferred.

Experience working within an EMR such as Epic or NexGen, preferred.

Experience using Excel, Tableau, or other reporting tools.

Ability to use data points to drive improved clinical outcomes.

Ability to translate clinical needs and business requirements into usable dashboards and reports.

Knowledge or familiarity with key clinical performance metrics.

Business Systems Analyst

ABOUT DOXA

DOXA Insurance Holdings is currently hiring a Business Systems Analyst. This is an exciting opportunity for a self-motivated professional who is comfortable working independently and able to show initiative while working on multiple projects.

DOXA Insurance Holdings is a Midwest-domiciled holding company that acquires specialty niche-focused insurance distribution companies such as Managing General Agencies, Wholesale Brokers, Program Administrators, and Retail Agencies. We currently have 13 businesses throughout the United States.

JOB SUMMARY

We are seeking a Business Systems Analyst that can become an expert in our corporate applications, specifically our Policy, Invoicing & Claims Administration system. This person will work directly with the vendor and their team of analysts and developers, other Business Analysts on our team and our Business Users.

The ideal candidate will be a problem solver that likes working with people on solutions. They will have solid technical skills to do system configuration, form and report building. They will be able to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical people.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Be a full-cycle Business System Analyst providing our businesses with a top-notch end-user implementation experience. You will set up apps and implement our software while instructing the end user in its usage.
Learn system applications, specifically Sunlight Solutions, such that you can configure solutions in the tool.
Use Visual Basic and SQL to build Forms in Sunlight
Understand the business needs for Operational and Accounting Reports and work with the Sunlight team to build them and the business teams to utilize them
Analyze existing processes and systems and document them in process flows
Collaborate with business users & developers to execute business requirements
Envision a modern, efficient future state and document future state requirements
Build test case documentation and execute test cases
Research issues start to finish: work with users on identifying and documenting the problem, ask questions, get the right people involved and come up with the best solution
Keep multiple projects moving simultaneously. We are a growing business and priorities will shift and adjust accordingly

QUALIFICATIONS
The successful candidate will have the following qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or 4 Year Military Experience
3+ Years of Business Analyst or Systems Analyst Experience
3+ Years of Experience in the Insurance Industry
Policy Administration Experience a plus
Forms and Report building experience
Excellent communication skills, both oral & written
Proficient with MS Office applications (Outlook, Word, SharePoint) with working knowledge of Adobe Acrobat (PDF).
Positive attitude and good working with multiple people
Desire to learn and grow with the business

BENEFITS

DOXA offers employees an excellent work environment with opportunities for growth. We offer flexible work schedules and casual work attire & environment. The home office is on the 10th floor of the Indiana Michigan building at 101 E. Washington in downtown Fort Wayne, IN. While we prefer the position be in Ft. Wayne, we will consider a remote worker if the person has the right experience.

Our compensation package includes vacation and sick compensation, health, dental, vision, life, and long-term disability insurance, and a matching 401(k) plan.

Job Title: Sr. Business Analyst, Customer and GTM Data Projects
Job Description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category

Finance

Job Details

About Salesforce

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

Description:
Trusted business data is the foundation for Salesforce to know our customers, meet our business goals, and innovate with intelligence and AI capabilities. This role will support our Customer & Go-to-Market Data Projects team on a multi-year journey to transform our business user experience in our core Salesforce instance. The Senior Business Analyst will understand the business processes and underlying data that impact our user experience, operational efficiency, and ability to fuel insights and AI. The Senior Business Analyst will participate in cross-functional requirements workshops, own requirements alignment, documentation, and approvals, and will become an expert with the functional lead in all aspects of the Account and Contact workstream.

This role must excel in drawing out the business’ point of view and pain points while balancing that with innovative product offerings and solutions to truly revolutionize the business experience. They must act independently and be able to own the analysis, recommendations, and impacts of assigned projects. This person must also be able to be successful in an unstructured, geographically distributed, team-oriented environment.

Our ideal candidate will have experience with Sales users or administering the Sales user experience through a transformational program. The right candidate should be able to think of out-of-the-box approaches to solving business problems as no two problems are the same. The individual must demonstrate an ability to be a self-starter and be prepared to roll their sleeves up to get the job done! Our team moves fast, so the ideal candidate will know how to ask the right questions to get help and remove roadblocks.

Responsibilities:

Participate in all pre-build workshops, pre and post workshop meetings with Functional Lead and experience design/storyboarding workshops
Business analysis and insight to build a point of view, drive alignment across the business, and ensure all documentation is clear and complete
Collaborate across the business to develop a holistic understanding of end-to-end business process and pain points
Summarize complex analysis in simple story-telling slides which makes it easier for stakeholders to understand the approach.
Create BRDs to define overall goals, problems we’re solving, requirements, and cross-functional dependencies for each feature
Create UAT test plans; participate in testing; report on and propose solutions for pass/fail test cases
Proactively manage action items to closure, creatively manage and clear ambiguity

Required skills & experience:

2-3 years of business analyst experience
Understanding of the Sales Process
Knowledge of the Salesforce Sales Cloud object model
Ability to work across multiple teams and build relationships to understand business operational process complexities

Preferred skills:

Experience with complex delivery programs - consulting experience is a plus
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science / Business / Mathematics or similar field
Ability to multi-task while managing deadlines, ability to perform well under pressure, and ability to work independently
Experience on AI projects and interest in intelligent use of AI
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
Ability to proactively QA your own work to ensure quality standards and requirements are met
Ability to identify & communicate road blocks proactively
Attention to Detail: hashtag (#) your favorite Excel formula somewhere on your resume.
Salesforce Certified Administrator
Project Management experience

Department



ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT (IN-ENRL-IUINA)

Department Information



Optimizing our enrollment mix is crucial to the long-term viability of IU Indianapolis. There are several factors that influence a student's college choice, persistence, graduation and success. The Division of Enrollment Management is comprised of over 100 full-time staff in the Office of Undergraduate Admissions, Office of Student Financial Services, Office of the Registrar, Office for Veterans and Military personnel, and Office for Enrollment Strategy and Insights, as well as other areas supporting student enrollment. The Division also oversees and provides insight for its enrollment operations for the Fort Wayne and Columbus campuses.

The Division is looking for individuals who value and embrace innovation, change and entrepreneurial mindsets and approaches in advancing the mission of IU Indianapolis.

We welcome applications from all individuals, regardless of age, gender, gender identity, sex, race, religion, color, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, national origin, or any other legally protected category.

For information about the department, please visit: Division of Enrollment at IUPUI.

Job Summary



Department-Specific Responsibilities

Serves the mission and directives of IUPUI by working collaboratively within the Office of Undergraduate Admissions with the Division of Enrollment Management offices and campus academic schools to achieve student recruitment, outreach, admissions, and enrollment objectives.
Provides project expertise in implementing student communication strategies, building and maintaining admission reports, translating business requirements into solutions with functional CRM configuration based on knowledge of business processes, various university student systems, and their relationship to CRM tools.
Defines, develops, maintains, and loads data from external and internal sources into our CRM systems. Structures and submits data to and from outside entities, conforming to unique specifications and requirements.
Designs, implements, and aids with the conceptualization and construction of communication campaigns, event campaigns, admissions reporting, and recruitment strategies (translating functional needs into appropriate systems). Provides instructions and guidance to staff, plans work, provides feedback and establishes timelines for team projects.
Manages reviews of system features with functional staff and provide recommendations for improvements.
Coordinates CRM training, documentation, reporting, communication, and support efforts for the office.
Develops standards and business practices to best utilize the CRM system and program features including consistent data collection and management.
Consults and collaborates jointly with the Operations and Student Experience Teams, within the Office of Undergraduate Admissions, to provide project expertise in implementing student communication strategies in support of the campus mission and objectives related to student recruitment and initial enrollment.
Develops standards and best practices in implementation of communication strategies using key enterprise and local systems developed to automate and customize communications.
Acquires and maintains knowledge of numerous related students' systems (SIS, workflow, etc.).
Develops campaigns and reports for campus events and recruitment outreach initiatives; implement standards for data entry across all platforms.
Provides analysis of existing data and data structures that satisfies ad-hoc reporting/analysis requests.
Designs and implements an assessment plan to gauge success of the student communication strategies; gather and analyze system campaigns and constituent feedback to provide recommendations for improvement.
Creates reporting specifications for new reports/dashboards/analytical tools and assists in testing/validation.
Defines, develops, maintains, and loads data from external and internal sources into our Constituent Relationship Management (CRM) systems, Translates plain-language requests into CRM reports. Structures and submits data to and from outside entities, conforming to unique specifications and requirements.
Coordinates office training, documentation, communication, reporting, and support efforts with emphasis on communication content, timing, assessment, and improvement; serves as resource on functional questions from Enrollment Management offices. Also include the role of campaign manager, executing planned communications with prospective and admitted students across student types. Documents data analysis efforts (data sources, reporting specifications, tools, issue/problem resolution).
Works collaboratively with other CRM system users across the Division of Enrollment Management and university to ensure completeness and integrity of the system data.
Contributes to the continuous design and development of new and emerging communication initiatives for constituent offices.
Creates step-by-step process testing scripts and perform detailed functional system testing, assist in resolution of issues, present final test results, and obtain agreement and approval of system features and upgrades.
Performs other related duties incidental to the work described herein.

General Responsibilities

Conducts experienced assessments to understand client business needs and strategic direction and identifies technology solutions to achieve goals; consults with IT staff and business users to identify, analyze, refine and document business requirements and processes and develop associated solutions.
Facilitates and leads interviews, focus groups, and workshops to establish current and future business requirements; coordinates the communication between stakeholders and service owners in order to effectively implement solutions.
Performs experienced business analyses, including construction of data models, business use cases, process flows and technical specifications for transition to IT solutions; establishes system requirements through functional and technical assessments of existing software.
Provides stakeholders with necessary analysis documentation for buy-in, leadership decision, and implementation; conducts walk-throughs of recommended system functionality and prototypes with business users in small group or large group settings.
Ensures uniform documentation presentation and content structure including, but not limited to, online documentation.
Develops test plans and conducts system/integration testing; can test changes, enhancements, and new programs or functions to ensure they meet business needs.
Qualifications



Combinations of related education and experience may be considered. Education beyond the minimum required may be substituted for work experience. Work experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted for education.


EDUCATION

Required

Bachelor's degree.

WORK EXPERIENCE

Required

2 years of business analysis experience working on complex problems and producing concrete, actionable solutions.

Preferred

Experience in student services, admissions, higher education, marketing or related CRM.
Experience working with enrollment management environments or other complex electronic data applications.

SKILLS

Required

Proficient communication skills.
Maintains a high degree of professionalism.
Demonstrated time management and priority setting skills.
Demonstrates a high commitment to quality.
Possesses flexibility to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment.
Seeks to acquire knowledge in area of specialty.
Highly thorough and dependable.
Demonstrates a high level of accuracy, even under pressure.
Service-oriented and skilled in providing positive, friendly customer service.

Preferred

Strong technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to analyze the business processes and systems to identify and resolve problems, recommend solutions, or modifications.
Ability to ensure data integrity and the quality delivered.
Proficient collaboration and consulting skills.
Strong listening skills.
Ability to communicate in complex environments and handle multiple complex tasks simultaneously.
Demonstrated ability to self-monitor quality control and accuracy.
Ability to work collaboratively with front-facing colleagues.
Proficient with Salesforce CRM solutions.
Proficient understanding of Microsoft Office Suites (word processors, spreadsheets, presentations, publications and databases).
Working Conditions / Demands



This role requires the ability to effectively communicate and to operate a computer and other standard office productivity equipment. Ability to sit for long periods of time at a computer workstation. The position involves sedentary work as well as periods of time moving around an office environment and the campus. The person in this role must be able to perform the essential functions with or without an accommodation.

Equipment utilized: Standard PC workstation; laptop; iPad; general office equipment (phone, copier, fax, scanner).

Additional Information



Level of Decision Making

Position requires individual to function as a team member and a consultant to departmental and campus clients on new and innovative applications of custom and vended software in the implementation of a successful communication strategy. Individual must understand various student system interrelationships & data and work with a variety of constituents across the campus to implement and experiment with new & alternative ways to leverage the CRM, and appropriately apply that knowledge to each academic or enrollment management setting. Must be confident in taking the lead and guiding others to think broadly and creatively in using new and innovative methods of communication as part of the campus strategic plan.
While some standardization is to be expected in the use of a vended system, this position is expected to listen and assess user need and translate that need successfully into the system and social media activities. This individual is expected to work independently and monitor accuracy, consistency, timing, success without direction.
Develop a compelling, focused, well-timed communication strategy for campus units and then molding those individual plans into a comprehensive campus strategy is no small task. Many of these communication channels reach large numbers of individuals electronically so this individual must have an excellent sense of the impact of his/her actions on those receiving the message as well as the units represented. This individual must also have a calm demeanor to recover in the face of problems or issues that may arise.

Scope and Impact

This position is responsible for the daily administration and articulation of campus-wide software applications in support of IUPUI's recruitment communication strategies. The CRM application has the potential to significantly influence decisions made by students with respect to enrolling at IUPUI. As such, this individual must always work with respect and understanding of the scope and impact of their actions which could lead to thousands of communications on behalf of departments or schools on campus. This individual must be able to measure the appropriate application and impact of social media tools and techniques as well. Failure to follow established business practices in generating communications campaigns could result in large numbers of students receiving the wrong communications and negatively impact their decision to enroll at IUPUI.



Work Location



IUPUI Campus Center

Indianapolis, Indiana

Role/Title: - Business Analyst
Onsite, Indianapolis , Indiana
Agency Interview Type: In person only

General Description
The Business Systems Support Analyst will work collaboratively with staff across the agency to conduct research, gather data, define business and functional requirements, and help with data entry and implementation of projects for Department of Revenue

Job Description
The Business Systems Support Analyst will work collaboratively with staff across the agency to conduct research, gather data, define business and functional requirements, and help with data entry and implementation of projects for the Department of Revenue. This position will also play a key role in the partnership between business technical teams. The incumbents leadership, expertise and work products will establish and operate processes that ensure issues are identified, tracked, diagnosed and resolved. This individual will work to ensure that business needs and plans are successfully integrated with project delivery. The successful candidate will be positive, enthusiastic and team oriented with a passion for identifying, designing, testing, and implementing critical functionality and processes, along with proactive quality assurance. The successful BA will have a strong desire to support the Department of Revenue mission, vision, and Pyramid of Excellence to drive high-quality service delivery and continuous improvement across the agency.

Essential Job Responsibilities:
The essential functions of this role are as follows:
Assists in the development of technical standards and policies to meet the customers, peers, and organization;

Company Description


We are a not-for-profit electric cooperative and wholesale provider of electricity to our owner-members. Headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana, we were created out of the need for reliable, affordable electricity in America's heartland. Our members are 23 electric distribution cooperatives (which makes us a co-op of co-ops), and their members include over 300,000 homes, businesses and farms in Indiana, Illinois and Missouri. As a not-for-profit co-op, our members are our owners, so we aren't influenced by shareholders and old practices. We are guided by the seven cooperative principles that govern all co-ops and values that are important to us, like teamwork and putting family first. We are a Deliberately Different kind of power provider- built for stability and growth and focused on the future. And that's good news for the people and businesses who depend on us.


What’s in it for You?

At Wabash Valley Power, we take a deliberately different approach to our workplace culture. What benefits our employees, benefits our company!

We offer great pay and a comprehensive benefit package that includes medical, dental, life insurance, 401(k) match, Pension and more! However, here are more perks you receive when you join our team:

No Sweat – we offer a wellness program that includes a payroll credit for medical insurance, cash for gym fees and extra vacation days for participating. We’ll even throw in a discounted Fitbit to keep you on track!
Flex Time – our flexible schedule means you can work in your appointments or family events and maintain a comfortable work-life balance. Speaking of flexible, we offer a hybrid work environment for those who enjoy a mix of working both at home and in the office. Our core office days are Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday. So if you like working from home, you can do that on Mondays and Fridays!
Stay in School – we value employees who have a desire to learn, so we provide funds for continuing education. We also offer in-house training and ongoing professional development opportunities.
Keep it Casual – when you work for us, you work in comfort. Blue jeans are the norm in our office and we make them look good!
Work Hard, Play Hard – we reward our employees with generous vacation time, to the tune of up to 5 weeks off a year. Even our new employees receive credit for prior work experience.


Job Description


Serving as the liaison between business users, co-op members and the Technical Services team to analyze information needs, identify, and manage project scope, facilitate requirements gathering sessions (group and individual), proactively communicate project status including issues, timelines, budget, and resources needs.

Support projects through the entire lifecycle (planning, execution, and closure), ensuring projects are delivered on time within scope and within budget.
Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables in collaboration with stakeholders.
Create, manage, and report on detailed project plans, timelines, and budgets.
Identify, manage, and report project risks and issues, implementing mitigation plans as needed.
Facilitate communications and collaboration among cross-functional teams.
Conduct regular project status meetings and provide updates to stakeholders and Tech Services management.
Create and maintain current state and future state documentation, process flows, and diagrams.
Identify process improvement opportunities to define an ideal “future state”.
Elicit, translate, validate, document, communicate, negotiate, and manage requirements.
Work with stakeholders and SMEs on system specifications, functionality, user interfaces, system documentation, user manuals, training materials, testing activities, quality assurance, and user acceptance testing.
Deliver informative, well-organized oral presentations and written reports and timelines.
Coach colleagues across the organization in project management and business analysis techniques.


Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, technology, or related field.
5+ years in project management/ business analysis or relevant experience.
Project Management Certification or equivalent.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
Strong communications and interpersonal skills.
Detailed orientated.
Ability to track and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Must possess a flexible, patient, collaborative and creative approach.
Must be able and willing to assist outside of core role to help the team deliver results and overcome ambiguous circumstances and roadblocks.
Scrum project management experience a plus

Additional Information


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

You could be the one who changes everything for our 28 million members by using technology to improve health outcomes around the world. As a diversified, national organization, Centene's technology professionals have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.

Gathers and validates business / technology requirements to establish scope and parameters of requirements and define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics

Provides references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; provide help desk support; train users
Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends

Our Comprehensive Benefits Package: Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.

Job Description:
PURPOSE

The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst work directly with analysts and business team members to understand the analytical needs of the organization and develop reporting solutions to serve those needs. The role will investigate, analyze, and fix issues in all areas of the environment and assist in implementing new Business Intelligence solutions.

Develops, implements, and maintains reporting solutions for monitoring and analyzing business performance with an emphasis on interactive dashboards.

Troubleshoots and drives successful resolutions to all development related issues

Position requires extensive work using a computer

Experienced in developing solutions using BI software

Job Title: Director of Event Systems and Analytics (Business Analyst)
Job Description:
Special Instructions Summary



Candidates strongly encouraged to apply by December 5th,2023.

Department



AUDITORIUM (BA-AUTM-IUBLA)

Department Information



University Events & Conferences brings together these units of Indiana University to provide premier event experiences throughout the year:

IU Auditorium, showcasing world-class entertainment and cultural experiences for more than 80 years.
IU Conferences, creating and hosting conferences both on campus and across the globe that advance IU's strategic objectives and introduce young people to Indiana University.
IU Event Services, managing welcoming and safe live university gatherings, from sporting events to formal functions.
University Events, creating memorable gatherings and celebrations on behalf of IU leadership for the entire IU community.

We unite students, faculty, staff, alumni, donors, and friends of IU, as well as the public at large, at a wide array of important occasions.

For information about the generous benefits offered by IU, click here.

Job Summary



The Director of Event Systems and Analytics is the senior leader responsible for strategic vision for system and process enhancements, new system evaluation, acquisition, and adoption, and optimizing the systems and data analytics employed by University Events, IU Conferences, IU Auditorium and IU Event Services. On behalf of these units, this role also serves as the primary liaison to multiple vended solutions and internal providers that are required to manage over 1,000 annual events, including university ceremonies, major conferences, Broadway and concert tours, academic productions, advancement events, celebrity artists, and international dignitaries.

General Responsibilities

Conducts complex experienced assessments to understand client business needs and strategic direction and identifies technology solutions to achieve goals; consults with IT staff and business users to identify, analyze, refine and document business requirements and processes and develop associated solutions.
Facilitates and leads interviews, focus groups, and workshops to establish current and future business requirements; coordinates the communication between stakeholders and service owners in order to effectively implement solutions.
Performs experienced business analyses, including construction of data models, business use cases, process flows and technical specifications for transition to IT solutions; establishes system requirements through functional and technical assessments of existing software.
Provides stakeholders with necessary analysis documentation for buy-in, leadership decision, and implementation; conducts walk-throughs of recommended system functionality and prototypes with business users in small group or large group settings.
Ensures uniform documentation presentation and content structure including, but not limited to, online documentation.
Develops test plans and conducts system/integration testing; can test changes, enhancements, and new programs or functions to ensure they meet business needs.
Qualifications



Combinations of related education and experience may be considered. Education beyond the minimum required may be substituted for work experience. Work experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted for education.


EDUCATION

Required

Bachelor's degree (preferably in analytic or computer science related field)

WORK EXPERIENCE

Required

5 years of business analysis experience working on complex problems and producing concrete, actionable solutions

SKILLS

Required

Proficient communication skills
Maintains a high degree of professionalism
Demonstrates time management and priority setting skills
Demonstrates a high commitment to quality
Possesses flexibility to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment
Seeks to acquire knowledge in area of specialty
Highly thorough and dependable
Demonstrates a high level of accuracy, even under pressure
Demonstrates analytical skills
Service-oriented and skilled in providing positive, friendly customer service

Preferred

Experience with PCIDSS and/or payment systems
Working Conditions / Demands



This role requires the ability to effectively communicate and to operate a computer and other standard office productivity equipment. The position involves sedentary work as well as periods of time moving around an office environment and the campus. The person in this role must be able to perform the essential functions with or without an accommodation.

Work Location



Bloomington, Indiana

Benefits Overview



For full-time staff employees, Indiana University offers a wide array of benefits including:

Multiple plan options for medical insurance
Dental insurance
Health Savings Account with generous IU contribution
Life insurance, LTD, and AD&D options
Base retirement plan contribution from IU, subject to vesting
Additional supplemental retirement plan options
Tuition benefit for IU classes
10 paid holidays per year
Generous Paid Time Off
Paid Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

Learn more about our benefits by reviewing our online Benefits Brochure.

Job Classification



Career Level: Advanced

FLSA: Exempt

Job Function: General Administration

Job Family: Business Analysis

CGS is looking for business analysts to work with a large federal agency! As a Business Analyst in Business operations and Content Strategy for CGS, you will partner with internal business owners and external partners to understand new business opportunities and define functional requirements.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.
Skills and attributes for success:
Support the development of briefings, agendas, and other general documentation support as directed, including training material and demonstration sessions for new and existing technologies to various stakeholders.
Document and analyze business and functional requirements so that they may be accurately translated into process maps and technical system requirements
Develop comprehensive documentation that meets organizational standards, to include but not limited to basic system architectural diagrams/wireframes, concepts of operations, monthly status reports
Create high-level briefings and communications materials for customers, management, and executive stakeholders
Work with the government and team members to identify, recommend, and implement opportunities for service delivery improvement and new technology implementation
Evaluate program materials and develop innovative approaches for improvement
Independently gather information from subject matter experts to develop, organize, and write procedure manuals, technical specifications, and process documentation
Develop and implement a deep understanding of Microsoft and Atlassian products and services (Teams, SharePoint, Visio, Jira, Confluence) to translate complex product information into simple, polished, and engaging content
Research, outline, write, and edit new and existing content, working closely with various team members to understand project requirements
Develop content in various media forms for maximum usability, with a consistent and cohesive voice across all documentation
Perform risk management, including identifying, prioritizing, and mitigating risks, and communicating and escalating risks and issues
Support a continuous improvement process by providing recommendations on improving products, services, and processes.
Manage client interaction and expectations regarding team efforts
Identify and coordinate cross-team dependencies and collaboration
Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, develop and deepen long-lasting client relationships

Qualifications:
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Bachelor's Degree (Computer Science, or engineering)
Must be able to successfully complete a stringent Background Investigation and obtain required Government Security clearance
7+ years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, and/or design of information systems programs and related business processes
Experience working with phase-based and Agile delivery methods
Experience with Jira or other Agile tools
Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical users.
Must be able to work well both in a team environment and independently.
Must possess exceptional attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Familiarity with government projects and policy/procedures teams
Demonstrates ability to interact comfortably with Senior Leadership and/or Government Executives and staff on a day-to-day basis
Experience in managing client requirements and small teams
Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skills

Ideally, you will also have:
Experience supporting DHS HQ or other US Federal Agencies
Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution
Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences
Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle
Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
Project Management, Agile, and/or Cyber Certifications (PMP / ACP / CSM / SAFe / CISM)

Our Commitment:
Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.

For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.

Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come.

Job Overview


Provide expert analysis and support for priority corporate IT projects supporting finance initiatives related to efficiency, reporting, documentation, and process improvements. Responsible for performing financial analysis to evaluate operational performance and support budgeting and decision-making, as well as produce reports related to daily/monthly/quarterly financial and production results. Ensure accuracy, automation and understanding of system-wide, key statistics that drive revenue and costs. Increases opportunities for adoption and usage of key statistics in reporting and accountability. Ensure all projects and outcomes are conducted in compliance with state and federal regulation and company policies and established Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).


Principal Accountabilities


Gather requirements, design, create, and deploy reports that support financial reporting initiatives. Develop custom, data-driven and responsive visualizations and dashboards for business users of various backgrounds and expertise.

Represent the Bank to both internal and external customers in a courteous, professional manner in face-to-face, written and telephone communications. Accountable for adherence to compliance standards including Bank Secrecy Act (BSA), quality of project implementation and meeting project financial and service goals. Actively protect confidentiality of customer and account information. Demonstrate Horizon Bank’s commitment to the communities we serve through involvement in local organizations and events.


Duties

Perform administrative tasks and system maintenance including managing business rules, uploading / downloading critical data, updating lookup tables, troubleshooting issues, administering security and access to Horizon’s financial reporting platform
Analyze business requirements and translate them into effective & efficient application configuration;
Work directly with third-party vendors in all aspects of setup, administration and support of financial reporting systems.
Develop, document, and implement policies, procedures, guidelines, and best practices to ensure data integrity and standardized end user processes.
Development of User Documentation and Training Materials.
Perform all work in compliance with established regulations, policies, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and instructions.
Maintain customer confidence and protect bank operations by keeping information private and confidential.
Participate in ongoing skill, compliance, risk management and security training as required for the position and apply knowledge in daily tasks.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications & Skills

College degree in IT, or finance and 2 years IT, Finance or Operations experience in financial services.
Must possess and demonstrate a strong knowledge of financial management and accounting theory and practice.
Strong analytical, conceptual, and data literacy skills
Strong knowledge and proficiency using Microsoft Office applications such as Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Visio.
Exceptional organization, time management and follow-up skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively with customers, bank employees and outside service providers.
Experience using Axiom financial reporting platform preferred
Ability to follow detailed instructions and a wide range of procedures requiring sound judgment.

Accountability

The Senior Business Analyst provides strategic business analysis services to business partners. They work closely with the business units to gain in-depth understanding of customer's business strategy, processes, services, roadmap and the context in which the business operates. This role will be key to understanding the documenting capabilities needed to address business challenges.
The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for reviewing assigned business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational, financial and technological risks. Identify opportunities to improve efficiency.
Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Identify and Document Business Requirements (70%)
Works independently with internal or sometimes external stakeholders to identify and clarify complex business requirements
Translates complex business and design requirements into technical requirements.
Work with Subject Matter Experts, Process Owners and End Users to gather and analyze business requirements.
Directs and owns process/system changes and reviews process changes to ensure design changes meet business requirements.
Determines opportunities to redesign business processes that will optimize better business results.
Liaison Between Business Unit and Technology (20%)
Facilitates meetings with business stakeholders and Enterprise Technology (ET) to understand business requirements; demonstrates deep understanding of business needs and recommends design changes for complex challenges
Act as a liaison between business departments, key stakeholders, vendors and IT to elicit, document, analyze and validate business requirements.
Proactively anticipates conflict based on prior experience, involves ET and business customers as appropriate, mediates between parties and resolves
Takes ownership of issues and resolution at a strategic level.
Coaches & Mentors Business Analyst (10%)
Coaches co-workers and provides feedback to enhance skills and knowledge.
Shares examples and insights with junior team members
Qualifications (Education, Experience, Certifications & KSA):
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent combination of education and experience, required
8 – 10 years related work experience
Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) Certification required

Sr. Business Risk Analyst


Salary Range : $61,900 - $92,900 Annual

Job Details

The stated pay range is based on a national-average location. Actual salary is determined by factors including relevant work experience, skills and location. This position is bonus eligible.

CNO Financial Group is hiring a Sr. Business Risk Analyst to be responsible for analyzing controls and efficiencies, while partnering with business unit management to develop viable solutions to remediate moderate to complex operational risk(s) for the Enterprise Operations and Information Technology/Infrastructure areas.

This is your opportunity to lead collaborative efforts with business partners to generate consistency across the organization, providing guidance as necessary to others within Operational Risk Management.

As a Sr. Business Risk Analyst, your responsibilities will include:

Partner and collaborate with management and accountable parties to provide guidance and support development of remediation solutions
Identify issues requiring additional engagement or escalation
Develop and execute validation reviews, document results, and prepare reporting associated with remediation activities
Engage with Reinsurance Audits, including the evaluation and documentation of key processes and risks
Coordinate and communicate requests, perform validation activities and create documentation for Third Party Administrator/Outside Service Provider Questionnaires and Cybersecurity Exams
Provide feedback for team members regarding validation approach, completion, and documentation
Host internal sessions to review effectiveness/efficiency of remediation activities and facilitate identified training needs
Independent identification of potential risks for discussion with the Operational Risk management team
Assist with the development of key management deliverables, actively participate with initiatives, and provide support to Business Risk Analysts, peers and management

The Sr. Business Risk Analyst position is well-suited for you if you have:

Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills with a risk mindset
Knowledge of claims processing practices, policy administration, policy language, state insurance regulations and applicable business practices
Ability to collaborate in a team setting, while being self-motivated to complete assigned responsibilities
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Highly organized and able to handle multiple priorities simultaneously

What you’ll need:

Bachelor’s degree, in a related discipline, or 8 years of experience as equivalent
5 years of related work experience
3 years of previous Risk Management, Audit, or Insurance Industry experience

What will set you apart:

Experience in Information Technology or Information Security
Previous supervisory experience preferred

The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:

medical insurance
dental insurance
vision insurance
401(k) retirement plan with company match
short-term & long-term disability insurance
Paid time-off and corporate holidays,
paid parental leave
company paid life insurance

CNO embraces flexibility and encourages you to work where you’re most productive. Associates who live within a 60-mile radius of a corporate office (Birmingham, Carmel, Chicago, Orlando and Milwaukee) have access to come into that office.

Associates who live outside of a 60-mile radius of a corporate office (Birmingham, Carmel, Chicago, Orlando and Milwaukee) may perform this role full-time work from home (WFH) from any US based location, as long as you are willing to work central or eastern time zone hours.

All associates may be asked to travel to varying corporate offices periodically. Work cannot be performed from outside of the United States.

CNO provides life and health insurance, annuities, financial services, and workforce benefits solutions through our family of brands and supported by our associates and agents. Our customers work hard to save for the future, and we help protect their health, income and retirement needs with 3.2 million policies and more than $35 billion in total assets. Our 3,400 associates, 8,600 exclusive agents and independent partner agents guide individuals, families and businesses through a lifetime of financial decisions.

We are financially strong and well positioned for continued growth, and we are grounded in our core values of Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I); Integrity, Customer Focus, Excellence, and Teamwork. We have offices in more than 260 communities in the U.S., including our headquarters in Carmel, Indiana, and corporate offices in Birmingham, Chicago, Philadelphia, Orlando and Milwaukee.

At CNO Financial Group, we’re always looking forward—to the security and stability we help create for our insurance brands’ customers, and the growth we create within our own company. We're looking for ambitious people who want to do more. We'll provide you with opportunities to grow your skills through challenging professional experiences.

If you're looking for a culture that encourages development, helps you reach your potential, and rewards you for your contribution, then CNO Financial Group is right for you. For more information, visit CNOinc.com.

Trane Technologies has an exciting new opportunity to join our organization as a Senior Sales Operations Analyst in our Life Science Solutions business. The Senior Sales Operations Analyst will support strategic decision making and planning through analysis and enhancement of analytics and KPIs in support of the commercial organization. Analyses for sales operations pertain to sales reporting and analysis, sales forecasting and demand planning, Business Intelligence administration and support of best practices, pricing and margin analysis, compensation development, as well as ad hoc analysis as required.

This position will work cross-functionally with Marketing, Accounting, Contracts, Customer Service, Technical Service, Manufacturing, Planning, Purchasing and Sales teams to enable commercial leadership to make effective, analytically driven, and strategic operating decisions. The Sales Operations Analyst will build and execute on compensation programs that increase sales effectiveness. This position is also responsible for helping manage the Customer Relationship Management tool in support of the CRM Specialist and Power BI in conjunction with IT.

This position has been designated as Remote.

Responsibilities:

Promotes Trane values as demonstrated in personal productivity and quality of work, management of internal/external relationships, actively seeking out and participating in Continuous Improvement practices, and willingness to engage and support team initiatives.
Sales Reporting and Analytics - Create and distribute a wide breadth of standardized and custom reports and analyses. Reports and analysis should be completed in a timely manner with a high level of quality and be easily understood. These reports must be adapted over time as selling conditions/environment changes. Track and explain variances to plan and budget. Migrate standardized reports to Power BI enabling customers to pull data as needed. Determine the most effective way in which data can be presented based on user’s needs. Become subject matter expert for Power BI.
Forecasting & Demand Planning – Manage the bookings forecasting process from end-to-end beginning with the annual budget and funnel management to be translated into a demand plan for manufacturing. Emphasis on delivering accurate forecasts on a regular basis for financial reporting and planning. Development of annual bookings plan to serve as the basis for the revenue and profit plan.
Ad Hoc Analysis & Projects – Create required reports and analysis to provide decision support for management teams. Examples include trend reports, customer reports, customer segmentation, ROI on marketing promotions and campaigns, etc.
Process Improvement – Continuously review and improve current processes and reports to find more efficient ways to update reports and share information with stakeholders.
Pricing & Margin Analysis – Perform pricing and margin analysis to assist sales and management in setting pricing. Work with management to develop pricing strategies for multiple channels and purchasing organizations. Ensure that changes in pricing are communicated and updated in all systems.

Qualifications:

4+ years in analytical role required.
Support of sales or marketing in analytical role preferred.
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Marketing or other analytical/ business fields. MBA preferred.
Proficient with Microsoft Office products including Excel, Word and PowerPoint, with advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, if/then statements, nested functions, vlookups, formulas). Microsoft Dynamics CRM and BI experience preferred.

Key Competencies:

Ability to work independently and collaborate with teams inside/outside the department to reach common goals; open to and solicits diverse views and opinions from others; breaks down barriers to build consensus.
Ability to apply professional and technical expertise to identify innovative solutions that meet department and business needs.
Ability to clearly communicate quantitative information to all levels of the company.
Excellent financial analysis skills with a good understanding of how to manipulate data for analysis and reporting
Excellent organizational skills with close attention to detail
Strong oral and written communication and presentation skills oral/written communication
Ability to understand intricate financial business problems and help determine appropriate solutions
Experience in managing multiple reports and diverse priorities

What’s in it for you:

Benefits kick in day one!
6% 401K match
3 weeks of vacation, plus site paid holidays
Benefits*: Trane-Technologies-Benefits-Offered.pdf\


Base Pay Range: $80,000 – $120,000


Disclaimer: This base pay range is based on US national averages. Actual base pay could be a result of seniority, merit, geographic location where the work is performed.

We're a team that dares to look at the world's challenges and see impactful possibilities. We believe in a better future when we uplift others and enable our people to thrive at work and at home. We boldly go.

Job Title: Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Business Analyst
Job Description:
We Are:

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

You Are:

An analytics consultant at heart, with broad knowledge of the digital analytics space and a deep understanding Adobe’s offerings and solutions. Bringing your experience implementing Adobe Customer Journey Analytics (CJA) and/or Adobe Analytics end-to-end solutions for clients, you know what it takes to transform cross-channel datasets into meaningful metrics and visualizations. Working closely with business stakeholders, you’re the go-to person for crafting insightful reports and dashboards that address critical business questions. On top of your technical expertise, you excel at leading project teams in fast paced environments and collaborating effectively with clients and team members at all levels.

The Work:

Lead teams to design, build, and maintain large-scale analytics solutions.

Strategize and implement Adobe Analytics and Customer Journey Analytics solutions together with client Business and Marketing teams, Architects, and Developers.

Work with client stakeholders to determine reporting requirements and KPIs for cross-organizational use cases.

Design and build cross-channel reports in Customer Journey Analytics to derive meaningful and actionable insights from large datasets.

Ensure that Data Governance policies and best practices are implemented and enforced across all systems.

Build and maintain Data Views and Connections in CJA, work closely with AEP Data Engineers to ingest additional data sources.

Provide and evangelize best-in-class documentation and enablement.

Articulate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and in writing.

Exemplify excellent consulting skills, diplomacy, effective messaging, and team mentorship abilities.

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.




What you Need:

A minimum of 3 years of experience implementing an Adobe Experience Cloud analytics product (Adobe Analytics or Customer Journey Analytics) along with Adobe Tags

A minimum of 1 year of hands-on experience working with Adobe Customer Journey Analytics.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (12 years) work experience (If an, Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience).

Bonus Points If:

Certified in at least 1 Adobe Experience Could product (Customer Journey Analytics, Analytics, Real-Time CDP, Journey Optimizer).

You are proficient in SQL, Python, or an equivalent coding language for data processing and analysis.

You have experience implementing Adobe Real-Time CDP or Adobe Target.
