Great companies need great teams to propel their operations. Join the group that solves business challenges and enhances the way we work and grow. Working at Gainwell carries its rewards. You’ll have an incredible opportunity to grow your career in a company that values your contributions and puts a premium on work flexibility, learning, and career development.


Summary

As a Claims Healthcare Business Analyst at Gainwell, you can contribute your skills as we harness the power of technology to help our clients improve the health and well-being of the members they serve — a community’s most vulnerable. Connect your passion with purpose, teaming with people who thrive on finding innovative solutions to some of healthcare’s biggest challenges. Works collaboratively with the client and team members-both external and internal to the company - to research, validate and document business needs, and to ensure that those needs are clearly reflected and completed. Assists with translating client requests and changes into the MMIS and may help determine solutions to business problems. Effectively manages client’s expectations.

Your role in our mission

Gainwell empowers you show you’re a pro and help clients deliver better health and human services outcomes using innovative technology and solutions.

Analyze, plan, design, document and make recommendations to improve business processes to support client’s technological aspirations and ensure that items are prepared for client meetings.
Be a supportive bridge between clients, project managers and technical personnel to define, track and communicate business requirements and their expected impact by building basic conceptual data and process models
Create, execute or analyze basic test scenarios to verify that client requirements are built into system design. Work with the client on change requests, publications and claim adjustments/reprocessing
Ensure that “intent of change” is carried out through every project phase by participating in technical reviews and inspections.
Assist with quarterly and annual CPT, HCPCS and diagnosis code updates in the system, ensuring rules are correct and working on edit and audit configuration. Certified coder is a plus..
What we're looking for
Five or more years of healthcare claims experience.
Must work collaboratively in a team environment in making changes to the reference system for CPT, HCPCS and ICD-10 coding updates and benefit plan coverage.
Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Excel and other software for conducting quantitative analysis
Strong analytical and business process re-engineering skills
Strong written and oral communication and presentation skills to deliver messages to business leaders, clients and technical personnel
An influencer and team player who that motivates others to action and communicates key technical ideas in a digestible way
What you should expect in this role
Fully remote opportunity from most US locations
Video cameras must be used during all interviews, as well as during the initial week of orientation.
#LI-HC1
#LI-Certified Medical Coder


The pay range for this position is $55,600.00 - $79,400.00 per year, however, the base pay offered may vary depending on geographic region, internal equity, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. Put your passion to work at Gainwell. You’ll have the opportunity to grow your career in a company that values work flexibility, learning, and career development. All salaried, full-time candidates are eligible for our generous, flexible vacation policy, a 401(k) employer match, comprehensive health benefits, and educational assistance. We also have a variety of leadership and technical development academies to help build your skills and capabilities.


We believe nothing is impossible when you bring together people who care deeply about making healthcare work better for everyone. Build your career with Gainwell, an industry leader. You’ll be joining a company where collaboration, innovation, and inclusion fuel our growth. Learn more about Gainwell at our company website and visit our Careers site for all available job role openings.

We celebrate diversity and are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Company Name: SMC Corporation of America - US SMC Pneumatics, Inc - CAN
Job Description:
The Sales Operations Analyst is a hybrid of traditional roles in strategic planning, sales operations, and business analytics – requiring a mix of strategy, market analysis, sales optimization, and operational support.

You will be responsible for facilitating end-to-end coordination that aligns SMC’s business strategies with its customers. Focused on developing and evolving operational processes and sales/marketing initiatives, with scalability and automation in mind. You will work closely with several departments to identify and solve issues, as well as implement new programs and processes that drive sales growth and streamline operational efficiency.

Sample projects range from the highly strategic to administrative including evaluating new sales growth strategies, business planning, onboarding new customers, and regular review of key performance metrics

Primary Responsibilities:

Collect, analyze, and evaluate data to track key performance metrics; Synthesize raw data into digestible and actionable information that supports senior management decisions
Liaise between customer and all levels of SMC's organization including senior management, sales division, customer service, supply chain, marketing, and finance groups.
Structure and drive key strategic initiatives focused on improving processes, programs, and overall business performance (i.e. Distributor Scorecard, Quarterly Business Reviews)
Coordinate with appropriate resources to troubleshoot, resolve and improve operational issues, efficiencies, and strength in market
Maintain process & policy documentation. Communicate changes to the appropriate groups
Support the Contract Administrative Group and management in defining, evaluation, managing and ensuring compliance with policies and terms of contractual agreements with indirect channel
Desired Skills/Experience:

2-3+ years of experience in sales, business or financial analysis and planning
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, or related field
Exceptional problem solving and critical thinking skills: demonstrated ability to structure complex problems and propose innovative solutions
Self-starter and high degree of motivation to go above and beyond the task at hand, with freedom to choose appropriate tasks, sequence, and methods to achieve results
Strong communication and presentation skills
Advanced MS Excel & Office skills required
Work experience in consulting or strategy/business operations is a plus

Do you want to be a business analyst/business process analyst?

Can you be comfortable being uncomfortable? Are you fine with always speaking your mind? Can you lead, execute, and stay focused despite many distractions, and do the work yourself if needed?

At Aculocity, we fight for the customer’s needs. We are disrupting the data industry by putting the customers’ needs first. We custom-build software designed to deliver value to the customer and integrate with existing systems and data to give the customer a holistic view of their business. We are a dynamic, fast moving, global technology consulting company that enhances business processes and uses technology to solve business problems and create leverage. Since we launched in 2006, we have delivered customer software development solutions, implementation of software systems, business intelligence and business process solutions.

It takes a special kind of person to be a part of this business in transformation. We are privately owned and expect our team members to act with an owner mindset: Relentless about creating value for the customer. Dogged about finding efficiencies and eliminating waste. Standing arm and arm with the rest of the team until the job is done—and ready to do it again the next day, with a smile.

It is not easy do things differently. But we do it—because we are passionate about improving our business and the lives of the people who use our tools.

We are also part of the GVW Group, LLC portfolio of companies, and we are a premier provider of technology services for all GVW portfolio companies as well as an expanding external client base.

Your Mission
The Business Analyst/Business Process Analyst is primarily responsible for streamlining, simplifying and improving end-to-end processes, driving a continuous improvement culture and solutions for a future state company expansion. The role requires a holistic approach involving cross-departmental collaboration, data-driven insights, and a focus on both short-term gains and long-term sustainability.


Key Traits
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work independently and manage competing schedules and priorities
IT Business Analysis and Business Process Analysis
Demonstrated domain knowledge in manufacturing verticals

Key Responsibilities

Work with specific departments to identify process inefficiencies and gaps
Work closely with the BRM and Product Owners in IT as well as the business to propose and implement improvements
Collaborate with department heads to understand their specific needs and pain points, ensuring alignment with business goals
Run workshops to address process inefficiencies
Leverage the Business Process Optimisation (BPO) Specialist and Global Process Advisor
Utilise process mapping techniques to map out and document existing processes within the department to identify areas for improvement and potential automation
Analyse relevant data to identify trends and patterns that could lead to process optimization
Partner with various IT groups for shaping and implementing successful process improvement initiatives.
Partner with Product Owners and Solution Architects to design solutions
Evaluate existing and emerging technologies that can be leveraged to improve business processes and enhance efficiency.
Define and capture high-level business requirements
Devise change management strategies to facilitate smooth transitions
Regularly review and optimize processes to adapt to evolving business needs and technological advancements.
Measure the effectiveness of process improvement initiatives and provide feedback for further enhancements


Position Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business or Information Technology or equivalent work experience
BA and/or BPMN or similar certification advantageous
Lean Six Sigma or similar certification advantageous
5+ years’ experience in gathering and documenting business requirements and/or business process optimisation
5+ years’ experience with business applications supporting: Sales, Engineering, Supply Chain and/or Manufacturing
Ability to work with a multitude of teams spread across an international company
Data analytics experience a plus
Experience in process mapping using tools and techniques such as Visio BPMN, 5S, PDCA, Gemba, Value Stream Mapping, Rapid Improvement Events advantageous
Strong consultative and advisory skills

Summary:

The Analyst, Doc Recovery & Corrections under general supervision, the Document (Doc) Recovery and Corrections Analyst is responsible for maintaining agency and/or investor relationship by researching, recovering, and correcting mortgage documents to complete the collateral files per the mandated guidelines to keep in compliance.

Essential Job Functions:

Supports assigned business unit, in monitoring and analyzing required documents to complete agency/investor mandates to meet SLA.
Maintains relationships with business units and investors.
Must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, to relay details between internal and external parties.
Conduct deep document research, as needed, with title companies, county clerks, and/or internal departments.
Ability to use independent judgement to manage and interpret investor guidelines to dispute back, where needed.
Review and compare documents to determine errors, based on agency/investor guidelines.
Facilitate and generate reports based on analysis, to show trends and common themes.
Goal oriented, as well as self-motivated with a sense of professional curiosity, desire to learn new things, and to find/recommend solutions to problems.
Quickly adapts to change and takes proactive approach to problem-solving.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, remain calm in stressful situations, be flexible, work well with many interruptions, and have multi-tasking capabilities.
General office duties, with phone calls outbound/inbound, emails, etc. when following up on recovery of documents.
Assisting with special projects, where applicable
Must exhibit very thorough detail orientation.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance.

Other Related Duties:

Performs other related duties as assigned.

Supervisory Responsibilities:

This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Education and/or Experience:

Bachelor's degree in business related field.
Three (3) to four (4) years of mortgage experience with processing documents.
Strong knowledge of Agency guidelines, Ginnie Mae, Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools with strong skills in Excel.
Problem resolution.
Critical thinker.
Business analysis or project knowledge, preferred.
Proficient in Ginnie NET and/or Mortgage Industry Custodian Site Portals, preferred.

Language Skills:

Ability to read and comprehend instructions, correspondence, memos, and workplace policies. Ability to analyze, interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, procedures, and governmental regulations. Ability to write professional correspondences. Ability to write routine business reports. Ability to speak effectively with other employees and/or customers. Ability to present formal information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, students, parents and/or other employees. Ability to present information and respond to questions from groups of administrators, managers, employees, customers and/or the public.

Mathematical Skills:

Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.

Reasoning Ability:

Ability to carry out detailed written and/or verbal instructions. Ability to solve problems involving concrete variables in standardized situations. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:

None required.

Work Complexity:

Tasks are multiple and diverse with some interrelationship across processes. Work requires the direct application of a variety of procedures, policies and/or precedents.

Physical Demands:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

Work Environment:

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Work is normally performed in a typical interior office work environment which does not subject the employee to any hazardous or unpleasant elements. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Overview/Risks:
Serve as technical team leader and work closely with business and technical partners across the enterprise to enable the implementation of end-to-end Business Intelligence solutions. Possess exceptional data transformation, warehousing and automation skills, as well as interpersonal skills to work cross-functionally and drive better data access and holistic analytics. Play a key role in the architecture, delivery and governance of reporting and data delivery
Responsibilities:
Manage reporting environments including data warehouse, data sources, security, licensing, and metadata.
Ensure evolving data warehouse is in lockstep with evolving analytics and reporting use cases, and partner with the infrastructure team to ensure the data warehouse scales with growth.
Responsible for planning, designing, configuring, developing, testing, deploying and supporting ETL/BI solutions. Develops and uses ETL applications to perform data analysis, create technical designs and provide applications support.
Partner cross-functionally with our infrastructure, engineering, and analytics teams to define and drive optimized data access and data-informed decision-making across the organization.
Write complex SQL scripts to extract data from variousdatabases and systems to make data available for enterprise reporting.
Responsible for establishing and maintaining data normalization and data integrity.
Facilitate automation of analytical and operational tasks and processes.
Create ope rational metrics and KPIs to improve data quality and operational efficiency.
Establish data management best practices to ensure completeness, cleanliness, and consistency across the entire data lifecycle.
Identify and revise enterprise reporting requirements.
Responsible for evaluation, installation, testing, implementation, maintenance and troubleshooting of new or upgraded BI Applications.

We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst who will assist our organization with evaluating and enhancing existing processes and being a solid contributor in defining, designing, and developing new processes and procedures that enable our company to scale efficiently while growing. Duties and Responsibilities

Collaborate companywide to identify and analyze opportunities for efficient business solutions.
Design, develop, and document streamlined, effective business processes, communicating clearly to management and teams.
Develop and execute project plans to resolve system and process issues in a dynamic environment.
Collect and analyze data to measure the effectiveness of process enhancements.

Prepare quantitative and qualitative reports on industry trends.

Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

Context

The shift within Higher Education more from one-time purchases of print textbooks to recurring subscriptions of digital products has generated a wealth of data about our products, customers, opportunities, and sales.

We’re looking for a leader who can take this information and leverage the latest data analytics tools, especially Tableau, to provide insight into the performance of business.

Reporting to the Director of Business Intelligence and sitting within the Strategic Sales Operations wing of US Higher Ed Sales Operations, the Sr Business Intelligence Analyst leads the analyses of the sales pipeline, net sales, subscriptions, and market data across multiple formats, models, and channels.

Responsibilities

Forecasting Mastery: Take the helm in owning all aspects of forecasting seasonal revenue, turning data into a strategic asset for our team.
Collaborative Insight: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, finance, and product, to deliver accessible and consumable insights into the success of our higher education products.
Dashboard Stewardship: Support the lifecycle of our Tableau dashboards, ensuring they remain up to date with the latest features and capabilities while streamlining and retiring those that are no longer necessary.
Analytical Evolution : Drive the evolution of our analytics capabilities from self-service to predictive and early alert insights into product, sales, and market trends.
Data Integrity Guardian : Manage functional areas of data management, forecasting, contacts, leads, opportunities, dashboards, and reports, ensuring data integrity across our systems.
Strategic Partner: Assist in turning sales data into actionable insights that inform our go=to-market strategy, emphasizing focus areas, maximizing revenue, and preventing revenue leakage.

Essential Skills:

Holistic Business Understanding: Detailed comprehension of the sales business process and the ability to translate business needs into technical specifications.
Communication Prowess: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex topics and present them thoughtfully to senior leaders.
Tech Savvy: Comfort with navigating the complexity of data across legacy and third-party platforms, ensuring forward momentum while simplifying and standardizing.
Organizational Agility : Strong time-management and organizational skills to balance multiple competing priorities.
Data Expertise: Background with ETL logic, data modeling concepts, and 5+ years of experience in a technical data role.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or computer-related program
5+ years of experience in a technical data role, such as analyst, engineer, architect, or scientist 5
5+ years of experience with multiple versions of SQL
5+ years of experience building and maintaining Tableau dashboards

Preferred Skills

Proficiency with Salesforce Sales Cloud (Marketing & Services Clouds a plus)
Proficiency with cloud databases such as Google BigQuery or Snowflake
Experience with machine learning concepts such as predictive modeling, categorization, and clustering
Background with programming in a language such as R or Python
Experience working in or supporting Sales or Revenue Operations a plus

Key Responsibilities

Service Operation
Responds to internal customers to resolve their technology problems.

Documents project plans, budgets, requirements, and testing.

Communication – Delivers accurate, clear, and concise messages orally and/or in writing.

JOB SUMMARY

The Director Business Intelligence is responsible for developing and executing the organization’s business intelligence function, driving data-driven decision-making and infusing analytics into the fabric of ELI across all levels of the organization. This role will provide actionable insights and analytical rigor in support of strategic business objectives and external partnerships.




ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Establishes and executes a vision for the delivery of information and analytics solutions for key stakeholders, including senior leaders and functional leads, as well as external partners and stakeholders;
Leverages analytics and research to identify internal/operational and external environment issues impacting ELI’s ability to deliver on its mission and proactively relays those issues to the attention of relevant business owners;
Coordinates and prioritizes business intelligence reporting needs across functions to produce reports, interactive dashboards and other data visualizations;
Develops and implements solutions to continuously monitor and improve data integrity and quality;
Develops and maintains consistent business terms and definitions and business intelligence policies and procedures, including overall data governance and related training and communications plans;
Stays current on existing and emerging BI technologies and solutions;
Other duties as assigned to advance the mission of Early Learning Indiana.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & REQUIREMENTS

An individual must have the following education and/or experience:

Bachelor’s degree in related field
5+ years of experience in survey research, market intelligence, applied analytics or related field



COMPETENCIES & SKILLS

The successful team member will demonstrate individual competency in the following areas:

Creative and critical thinking skills
Excellent presentation, writing and communication skills
Strong technical skills and a working knowledge of CRM, listening tools and other survey and data analytics tools
Demonstrated experience in BI platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Familiarity with geo-spatial analysis tools and mapping competency
Proven project management, time management and multi-tasking abilities while maintaining excellent attention to detail
Ability to provide accurate, insightful and intuitive analysis
Knowledge of diverse business practices, market techniques, segmentation and economics
Able to adapt communication style and approach to varying audiences and stakeholders

WORK CONTEXT

This is a hybrid work position. A successful team member will be expected to work productively:

Work from home 3 out of 5 days per week on average.
Work from the statewide office located at 1411 N. Roosevelt Ave in Indianapolis 2 out of 5 days per week, likely Tuesday and Wednesday but subject to change.
Be able to travel to and from events throughout the state as needed.

Early Learning Indiana is a nonprofit organization on a mission to ensure children throughout Indiana are empowered with essential skills to thrive in kindergarten and beyond. We practice what we teach by operating a network of premier, community-based lab schools – called Day Early Learning centers – where we advance the science of early education, invest in a new generation of teaching and instill essential skills in nearly 1,000 children each day. Company Description:
Harmony Healthcare IT (HHIT) provides technology solutions for healthcare organizations by safeguarding protected clinical information, increasing productivity, and maximizing cash flow. HHIT specializes solely in healthcare technology – driving accessibility, security, efficiency, and quality for our customers who rely on accurate clinical data to provide care for their patients. HHIT is best known for excellence in data extraction, migration and retention of healthcare records ensuring system reliability and data integrity 24/7. HHIT is growing and seeks to add key members to the team to help continue our mission of helping the healthcare system work better for everyone.
HHIT has established core values for the workplace. This helps to maintain a culture of excellence and provides guidance in our daily work.
HHIT’s core values are:
Do the right thing
Be easy to work with
Exceed expectations
Serve humbly
Never stop improving

Roles and Responsibilities

Site/region strategy and execution of manufacturing finance activities, coordinating planning, pacing, and closing activities. Provides informal guidance to new team members. Explains complex information to others in straightforward situations.
Impacts projects, processes and procedures in own field. The role operates with some autonomy, but is focused on execution of activities/provision of advice within an enabling discipline covered by standard functional practices and procedures. Activities require professional judgment, but may require more senior levels of guidance.
Utilizes technical expertise and judgement to solve problems. Leverages technical skills and analytic thinking required to solve problems. May use multiple internal sources outside of own team to arrive at decisions.

GENERAL PURPOSE AND SCOPE OF THE POSITION:

Under the direction of the Student Financials Systems Architect, this position is responsible for maintaining the performance of the Ivy Tech student financial systems, including oversight of assigned modules. The Student Financials Senior Business Analyst is a member of the Ivy Tech Student Financials System Administration team in Ivy Tech’s Business Affairs division.

The Student Financials System Administration team is responsible for managing a broad portfolio of financial aid applications, integrations, and reports.

The Student Financials Senior Business Analyst must have a strong student financials background with experience of one or more ERP implementation(s) and configuration(s) while maintaining a rigorous commitment to quality, security, and attention to detail.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Act as the product owner for assigned Workday functional areas.
Provide support for Ellucian Banner and existing financial aid applications throughout the development and implementation of Workday Student.
Maintain, review, and prioritize backlog with stakeholders while providing recommendations for project management.
Review Business Analysts’ and peer activities; articulate ideas and viewpoints to senior management, including review of policy documentation.
Lead sessions with key business leaders and stakeholders to deeply understand what business problems we are trying to solve, key questions to be answered, and how the solution developed will fit into the business process to be supported.
Lead interactive design sessions using best practices to effectively solve business problems by providing sample approaches as discussion points.
Provide process and/or alternative solutions and make recommendations based on cost/benefit and operational impact criteria.
Manage project schedules and identify/communicate risks by providing timely reporting on the overall project success, processes on targets achieved, and areas of focus and improvement.
Work with Quality Assurance to ensure adequate testing.
Own and drive escalated issues blocking production success.
Effectively use sound business judgment, risk avoidance, and subject matter expert (SME) resources to provide recommendations to solve problems.
Provide functional oversight of technical integrations.
Back up to Student Financials Systems Architect as needed.
Gather, document, and analyze business requirements from internal customers and stakeholders to define and build system modifications and enhancements.
Acquire in-depth knowledge of Ivy Tech’s business to identify opportunities for improving internal processes, driving efficiencies, and providing in-depth analysis to end users.
Develop documentation of systems, including but not limited to job aids, training manuals, and video guides.
Act as a point of contact for the internal business user(s).
Configure and support the bi-annual Workday upgrade processes, including evaluating and testing new functionality.
Participate in interactive design sessions using best practices to effectively solve business problems by providing sample approaches as discussion points.
Conduct root cause analysis to determine an appropriate action plan for break/fix and support issues.
Build and support Workday reports using various Workday reporting tools (Report Writer, Discovery Boards, Worksheets).
Develop partnerships with other Ivy Tech Workday module analysts, users, and/or administrators.
Assist by using sound business judgment, risk avoidance, and SME resources to coordinate with campus business offices to solve problems.
Act as a named support contact with Workday.
Develop and provide training to end-users.
Research, collaborate, and contribute to the Workday community user groups.
Some travel may be required within the state.
This is not to be construed as an exhaustive list. Other duties logically associated with this position may be assigned. All responsibilities will be conducted within the parameters of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), other applicable regulatory requirements, and professional standards.
SUPERVISION RECEIVED: Student Financials Systems Architect
SUPERVISION GIVEN: None
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from an accredited college/university.
Minimum 5 years of business analysis, technical business analysis, and/or project management.
Strong student financial background.
Strong foundation in analytical and problem-solving skills.
Must be able to work under deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Demonstrate the ability to analyze and document processes, procedures, etc.
Have a strong foundation in customer service mentality with excellent communication skills.
Must demonstrate ability to promote an inclusive environment that reflects the broad diversity and backgrounds represented by our students and employees and which every individual feels respected and valued.
Excellent documentation skills (samples of nonproprietary documentation may be asked for review).
Collaborative team player.
Proactive, with a sense of ownership.
Commitment to quality and attention to detail.
Willingness to learn new functions and technologies.
Strong consideration will be given to candidates with a background and/or experience in computer science, finance, or accounting.
SALARY RANGE: $85,000 - $90,000 Annualized

· Track and analyze sell through and inventory turns · Utilize sell through trends and inventory analysis to prepare and suggest overall company forecasts by account

Develop projections and forecasts
Monitor and evaluating sales performance by sku/ item type
Assist marketing and supply chain efforts

o Strong work ethic and willingness to take initiative

Shift 1 (United States of America)
Job Description-
Position Description:
Hillenbrand is looking for a Workday Product Owner to join our team. This role is a key member of the global HRIS Workday team – a team going through an exciting transformation. As a Workday Product Owner at Hillenbrand, you will be the "go to" HRIS Workday subject matter expert supporting Learning Management, Help/Knowledge Management and People Experience Journeys. Along with lead responsibility to maintain the Workday sustainment/support organization. You will collaborate globally with the functional teams and will be responsible for leading system design, testing of system changes, and end-user change management, as well as managing special initiatives.
Team:
You’ll join an incredible, global HRIS team of dedicated associates, working together to transform HR and the overall organization. You will be partner to the Talent & Learning Management leadership team to ensure we are optimizing the Workday capabilities.
What you’ll do:
Your priority will be to support the successful, global implementation of Workday Modules across 25+ countries.
After go-live, you will work closely stakeholders and users on day-to-day administration, as well as the key advisor for enhancements and new projects.
You will own and drive the prioritization of functional enhancements and initiatives, and partner with IT on technical enhancements, initiatives, and release management.
You will be the organization’s module expert, responsible for establishing long term system priorities and overall strategy in line with Workday’s roadmap and business objectives.
Provide consultation and guidance to the respective functional areas on Workday processes to ensure understanding and increase adoption.
Basic Requirements:
5+ years of experience in Workday system implementations, including design, testing, and deploying functionality.
5+ years of general software systems experience, including design, testing, and deploying functionality.
Experience advising all levels in the organization on Workday functionality.
Business Analyst skills, with the ability to interpret business needs, problem solve, and work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Demonstrate a global mindset with a with communication skills; able to interface well with users and other development teams both in and out of region.
Detail oriented and strong ownership of work, including documentation.
Demonstrate good judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive data.
Preferred Qualifications:
Workday Learning Certification (current or expired) is preferred.
Experience in quality assurance testing and Workday custom reporting
Experience training HR and end users
Who we are:

Hillenbrand (NYSE: HI) is a global industrial company that provides highly-engineered, mission-critical processing equipment and solutions to customers in over 100 countries around the world. Summary:

The Analyst, Doc Recovery & Corrections under general supervision, the Document (Doc) Recovery and Corrections Analyst is responsible for maintaining agency and/or investor relationship by researching, recovering, and correcting mortgage documents to complete the collateral files per the mandated guidelines to keep FMC in compliance.

Essential Job Functions:

Supports assigned business unit, in monitoring and analyzing required documents to complete agency/investor mandates to meet SLA.

Maintains relationships with business units and investors.

Must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, to relay details between internal and external parties.

Conduct deep document research, as needed, with title companies, county clerks, and/or internal FMC departments.

Ability to use independent judgement to manage and interpret investor guidelines to dispute back, where needed.

Review and compare documents to determine errors, based on agency/investor guidelines.

Facilitate and generate reports based on analysis, to show trends and common themes.

Goal oriented, as well as self-motivated with a sense of professional curiosity, desire to learn new things, and to find/recommend solutions to problems.

Quickly adapts to change and takes proactive approach to problem-solving.

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, remain calm in stressful situations, be flexible, work well with many interruptions, and have multi-tasking capabilities.

General office duties, with phone calls outbound/inbound, emails, etc. when following up on recovery of documents.

Assisting with special projects, where applicable

Must exhibit very thorough detail orientation.

Maintain regular and punctual attendance.

Other Related Duties:

Performs other related duties as assigned.

Supervisory Responsibilities:

This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Education and/or Experience:

Bachelor's degree in business related field.

Three (3) to four (4) years of mortgage experience with processing documents.

Strong knowledge of Agency guidelines, Ginnie Mae, Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac.

Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools with strong skills in Excel.

Problem resolution.

Critical thinker.

Business analysis or project knowledge, preferred.

Proficient in Ginnie NET and/or Mortgage Industry Custodian Site Portals, preferred.

Language Skills:

Ability to read and comprehend instructions, correspondence, memos, and workplace policies. Ability to analyze, interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, procedures, and governmental regulations. Ability to write professional correspondences. Ability to write routine business reports. Ability to speak effectively with other employees and/or customers. Ability to present formal information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, students, parents and/or other employees. Ability to present information and respond to questions from groups of administrators, managers, employees, customers and/or the public.

Mathematical Skills:

Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.

Reasoning Ability:

Ability to carry out detailed written and/or verbal instructions. Ability to solve problems involving concrete variables in standardized situations. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:

None required.

Work Complexity:

Tasks are multiple and diverse with some interrelationship across processes. Work requires the direct application of a variety of procedures, policies and/or precedents.

Physical Demands:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

Work Environment:

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Work is normally performed in a typical interior office work environment which does not subject the employee to any hazardous or unpleasant elements. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

We are Subway Headquarters! A dedicated team of professionals supporting thousands of franchisees around the globe.

Hungry for a fresh, new career? Look no further because one of the world’s most iconic brands can help you get there.
We are looking for Manager, Franchise Performance to support the Merrillville, IN territory.
The Manager, Franchise Performance will provide strategic business direction and alignment in order to influence Subway franchise owners in maximizing profitability of their portfolio and help to align store operating procedures to Subway's brand standards. This role will communicate the expected performance level of the locations and franchisees within their assigned area in relation to the company's KPIs and metrics. They will implement business growth by identifying potential operational opportunities for improvement and provide training to strengthen locations.

Position responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Provide operational and food safety guidance and education during restaurant visits: Consistently evaluate SUBWAY restaurants using the PBE model on quarterly basis.
Document adherence to Company compliance standards, improvements made, areas of opportunity and direction on how to improve, if needed during coaching sessions.
Evaluate how the restaurant is performing compared to SUBWAY policies and procedures, analyze sales and cost data and provide specific customized direction to improve in these areas.
Review franchisees portfolio and have regularly scheduled business reviews to see growth potential and areas of opportunity.
Coach and counsel franchisees to reach individual store and territory goals.
Provide guidance to franchisees to grow their business both within the local community in store and though online sales and delivery.
Build Territory Relations by visiting all assigned restaurants at least quarterly depending on performance level, communicating with franchisees via voicemail, e-mail, territory meetings, individual franchise meetings and written communications.
Gains respect from franchisees to be recognized as an asset to the business and leader in the field.
Assist Territory Director and shared services team with site reviews by conducting three day parts of customer intercepts for all reviews within assigned area
Provide direction and proficiency to franchisees and staff with regard to New Store Openings & Transfer Training Hours
•

The successful candidate will have:

Bachelor's Degree in Business, Communications, Business Analysis or related field preferred.
3+ years of restaurant experience preferred.
The ability to learn technology initiatives and cascade this knowledge to others.
Excellent written and verbal communication,
Ability to problem solve and business analysis skills.
High degree of detail orientation and ability to work within a team, hands on approach during in restaurant visits.
Must also be able to work autonomously and be professional.

Job title: SENIOR SALESFORCE ADMINISTRATOR

Summary/Objective: The Senior Salesforce Administrator will participate in the ongoing development, deployment, and support of our Salesforce org. The successful candidate will have a record of success in improving processes and adoption using the Salesforce platform. The administrator will work closely with stakeholders and subject matter experts to identify, develop, and deploy new business processes that support the sales, support and marketing needs at Samtec. This role is for the Senior Admin position but will most certainly require some business analyst skills. The Salesforce Administrator will be responsible for the executing and supporting the day-to-day configuration, maintenance, and improvement of our platform.

Essential Functions/ Responsibilities:
Serve as primary system administrator for the Salesforce.com environment with 400+ users.

Handle all administrative functions including user account maintenance, reports and dashboards, flow builder as well as lightning app builder and other point/click low-code automation.

Coordinate different roles, profiles and permission sets throughout the org to maximize organization and ease of use to our user base

Complete regular internal system audits and prepare for upgrades and feature deprecations.

Have extensive knowledge dealing with third-party app extensions within Salesforce.

Coordinate the evaluation, scoping and build out of new development requests for both Sales and Service teams.

Work with stakeholders to establish suitable processes to support administrative, development, and change management activities.

Assist in training/onboarding of new users and grow the Salesforce skill set across the organization.

Effectively act as a liaison between our users, vendors, and the application development teams.

Work with stakeholders, developers and supporting teams to define and document development requirements.

“The responsibilities as defined are intended to serve as a general guideline for this position. Associates may be asked to perform additional tasks depending on strengths and capabilities”

Required Experience:
Preferred 4-5 years as a Salesforce.com administrator.

Candidate must have thorough experience administering Salesforce on the Lightning Platform

Salesforce.com Admin (ADM201 and ADM211) certified.

Extensive experience in generating Reports and Dashboards

CRMA knowledge and experience a plus

Strong knowledge of automation tools, flow builder skills are required.

Expertise in data migration.

Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Administrator certifications preferred.

Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.

Strong understanding of the platform, with the ability to build custom apps and objects, formula fields, workflows, custom views, and other content of intermediate complexity.

Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality.

Strong data management abilities.

A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion.

A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements.

Previous experience working in a SCRUM or agile environment preferred.

Excellent time and project management skills, and a positive attitude

Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, handle and prioritize simultaneous requests.

Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills.

Must demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization.

Ability to critically evaluate information in the known environment to distinguish user requests from the actual underlying needs.

Ability to assess the impact of new requirements on Salesforce.com and all upstream and downstream applications, systems and processes.

Preferred Education:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent is required.

Job Title: Director (Business Analysis Leader), Research Compliance Management Systems
Job Description:
Department



RESEARCH COMPLIANCE (UA-RCIN-IUBLA)

Department Information



The mission of the Office of Research Compliance (ORC) is to ensure that research conducted by IU and affiliated researchers is not only in compliance with all applicable regulatory, statutory, and organizational requirements, but also meets the standards of best practices while minimizing impediments to research and burdens on the research community.

Job Summary



The Director is responsible for the full operational management of management systems for the Office of Research Compliance (ORC). Systems development and management for ORC has a university-wide, enterprise-wide impact, serving all Indiana University campuses and all faculty, staff, and students in regards to research activities and compliance.

Department-Specific Responsibilities

Directs and manages system integration efforts for the Office of Research Compliance (ORC).
Plays a crucial role in ensuring the successful implementation of mergers and acquisitions for system integrations for the enterprise research compliance systems.
Oversees and directs the management of budgets, timelines, and project deliverables for large-scale systems integration.
Builds and maintains strong relations with ORC leadership and functional project leads, including internal, external partners and vendors by communicating project updated, risks, and issues to all stakeholders at all levels.
Directs the creation of effective deliverables such as project plans, use cases, process flows, testing plans and documentation.
Provides guidance to compliance staff and ensure best practices related to data management, security, storage, and regulatory expectations.
Manages multiple priorities and projects simultaneously.

General Responsibilities

Provides highest level of operational leadership and coordination of assigned staff members to define business analysis methodologies and standards; provides direction and guidance on high priority business analysis projects/initiatives.
Establishes short-term business plans and long-term operational objectives, including managing project timelines/deliverables and developing resource plans for multi-project/multi-phase business analysis initiatives.
Conducts a variety of personnel actions to include, but not limited to hiring, promotion, performance management, and dismissal.
Manages high level assignments and allocation of technical resources, including negotiating and coordinating initiatives that involve staff in other departments/areas/teams.
Makes budgetary recommendations/proposals based on resource needs and ensures cost containment.
Works collaboratively with other business analysis leaders in recommending standards, best practices, and related policies/procedures.
Conducts research on emerging technologies, services, protocols/processes, and/or standards in support of business analysis efforts; responsible for the implementation of new protocols/procedures to address business needs.
Prepares management reports and summaries for senior administration, executive, steering and advisory committees; acts as advisor to executive committees; serves on various university committees and task forces related to business analysis.
Qualifications



Combinations of related education and experience may be considered. Education beyond the minimum required may be substituted for work experience. Work experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted for education.


EDUCATION

Required

Bachelor's degree (preferably in related field)

Preferred

Master's degree

WORK EXPERIENCE

Required

4 years experience in related field
1 years of management experience

Preferred

2 years experience related to research administration and/or research compliance, and/or regulatory compliance.
Knowledge of the systems development life-cycle, including systems analysis, design, and quality assurance.
Operations/support experience with enterprise business systems.

SKILLS

Required

Proficient communication skills
Maintains a high degree of professionalism
Demonstrates time management and priority setting skills
Demonstrates a high commitment to quality
Excellent organizational skills
Excellent collaboration and team building skills
Effectively coaches and delivers constructive feedback
Instills commitment to organizational goals
Demonstrates excellent judgment and decision making skills
Effective conflict management skills
Builds and manages effective teams

Preferred

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills are essential in working with senior university administration, outside institutions, and ORC leadership and functional area staff; team skills required as well
Excellent writing and public speaking skills, especially explaining highly technical material prepared for a general audience
Must be an intelligent, articulate and persuasive leader who can serve as an effective member of the senior management team
Working Conditions / Demands



This role requires the ability to effectively communicate and to operate a computer and other standard office productivity equipment. The position involves sedentary work as well as periods of time moving around an office environment and the campus. The person in this role must be able to perform the essential functions with or without an accommodation.

Work Location



Bloomington, Indiana or Indianapolis, Indiana

This position is eligible for remote work or to work a hybrid schedule (mix between remote and in-person work), subject to change in the future based on university policy and business needs.

Benefits Overview



For full-time staff employees, Indiana University offers a wide array of benefits including:

Multiple plan options for medical insurance
Dental insurance
Health Savings Account with generous IU contribution
Life insurance, LTD, and AD&D options
Base retirement plan contribution from IU, subject to vesting
Additional supplemental retirement plan options
Tuition benefit for IU classes
10 paid holidays per year
Generous Paid Time Off
Paid Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

Learn more about our benefits by reviewing our online Benefits Brochure.

Job Classification



Career Level: Sr. Operational

FLSA: Exempt

Job Function: General Administration

Job Family: Business Analysis

To guarantee full consideration, please submit your application within 5 business days of the Posted Date.

Job Title: Advisory Lead Business Analyst 1 - PDM Senior Consultant
Job Description:
Risk and Financial Advisory - Hybrid Operate

Lead Business Analyst - PDM Senior Consultant

Do you have a drive to be a part of the technology evolution , and a passion for turning challenges and opportunities into long-term competitive advantages? If so, please consider an opportunity with Deloitte under our Project Delivery Talent Model. The Project Delivery Model (PDM) is a talent model tailored to long-term, client service delivery. PDM practitioners are local to project locations, minimizing the need for extensive travel . As a Lead Business Analyst in our Hybrid-Operate business, you'll have the opportunity to gain valuable hands-on experience, share ideas, and collaborate with leading professionals as we engage a diverse set of industries with effective solutions

Work you'll do

As a Lead Business Analyst, you will work on client teams , supporting technology products - including onboarding new client implementations, performing data analytics, and expanding existing business features and functionality to meet client needs. You will be working with other analysts and developers to identify and address technical and non-technical issues. Additional responsibilities m ay include:

Documenting highly complex business processes, data flow and architecture for new systems and data
Creating business cases to provide cost effective solutions.
Following complex data flow to interpret source of information in support of new systems and data.
Recommend ing change s based on business system impact analysis.
Serving as functional lead in technical implementation of agreed upon solutions.
Translating business requirements into test cases
Facilitating User Acceptance Testing of system enhancements and new applications, including initial root cause analysis of failures
Preparing and presenting complex written and verbal materials such as reports, findings, and systems training
Building reports using Crystal Reports and SSRS and, ad-hoc queries and dashboards leveraging market leading business intelligence tools
Serving as an escalation point, and guiding less tenured business analysts to troubleshoot and resolve issues
Participat ing in Agile development process and contribut e to sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives
Help develop requirements for, and assist in testing of, software enhancements including providing market and user insights

The desired candidate is a team player who is passionate about learning and working with technology, finance, and alternative investments. The candidate will be detail oriented, possess strong listening, verbal/written communication skills, and able to collaborate well with others.

The Team

We are a growing global team of Analysts and Technology professionals. You will be working directly with team members at all levels, with the focus on enhancement or customization to meet the needs of our clients. Our teams understand the dynamics of serving complex, global clients across multiple industries, and the importance of increasing transparency around business performance. Learn more about our Deloitte Risk & Financial Advisory practice at Deloitte.

Technical Knowledge and Experience :

Required

Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience
5-7 years of relevant experience
Minimum of four years of work experience in IT and data driven projects as a Business Analyst/ Product Manager
Experience working in Agile projects with good understanding of Agile ways of working
Ability to influence peers and leadership stakeholders
Relevant certifications in Agile, Scrum or project management
Strong experience in IT consulting and business analysis - process definition, requirements gathering, Proficiency in writing Business Requirements Documents ( BRD ) , and Functional Specification Documents ( FSD )
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future. and user stories



The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $75,924 - $133,200.

Teradata is looking for a senior analyst to join our security operations team. The analyst will support the effective and efficient operations of the Security Operations Center, including next-gen artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) cyber security technologies, threat report generation, incident monitoring/response, and vulnerability management. This role will help to implement and support security best practices, policies, standards, and guidance to ensure the safeguard of company data, infrastructure, and resources from internal and external threats. The ideal candidate has a security engineering background and has an understanding for security operations.

What you’ll Do:
Drives cybersecurity activities across the enterprise and assist with security policies.

Complete security monitoring operations and manage vulnerability and threat assessments, network access control, incident response and maintenance.

Effectively manage, monitor, and communicate enterprise security risk by maintaining visibility across the agency enterprise.

Review escalated cyber incident tickets and conduct advanced threat hunting exercises to uncover unknown threats.

Assemble and review security assessment and authorization documentation.

Support briefings, meetings and communicate recommendations and contract status.

Manage the scope, schedule, and resource allocation for projects and sustaining activities

Support development of policies, strategies, and communications relative to cybersecurity

Analyzes and identifies trends in security log data from many heterogeneous security devices. Provides Incident Response (IR) support when analysis confirms actionable incident.

Provides threat and vulnerability analysis and offers security advisory services.

Analyzes and responds to previously undisclosed software and hardware vulnerabilities.

Investigates, documents, and reports on information security issues and emerging trends.

Manage cyber situational awareness of the cyber threat landscape and maintain threat monitoring services.

Applies knowledge of tactical to strategic level intelligence analysis of cyber threats, vectors, and actors in support of cyber defense and computer network operations.

Gather and report on security metrics that demonstrate the relative cost/benefit of the security operations and other cybersecurity initiatives.

Reduce cost and optimize enterprise cybersecurity posture through efficiencies, reciprocity, security shared services, and automation.

Effectively communicate and collaborate with internal and external key stakeholders

Performs other duties and projects as assigned.

Who You’ll Work With:
We are presently a US-based team conducting 24x7x365 monitoring to protect the company's valuable data assets. This role predominantly involves with regional team members, encompassing the Team Lead, Security Analysts, and Senior Security Analysts. It also requires close collaboration with SOC members in the US and abroad. Also, expect continual engagement with diverse departments spanning the entire organization.

What Makes You a Qualified Candidate:
Bachelor’s Degree in Cyber Security, Information Technology, or related field preferred and a minimum of five (5) years’ progressive information security experience is preferred.

Experience working in a Security Operation Center preferred.

Certified Information Systems Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), GIAC Security Essentials Certification (GSEC), GIAC Certified Incident Handler (GCIH), Security+, or other related certifications preferred.

What You’ll Bring :
Understanding of security methodologies.
Understanding of incident response process
Understanding of ticket-driven workflows.
Intermediate scripting knowledge in PowerShell, Python or similar languages.
Meet security audit mandates, standards, and requirements.
Experience in resolving issues and scheduling conflicts and solving complex problems
Excellent listening skills and communication skills include oral, written, and formal presentations
Ability to document all the technical findings and analytic approach.
Ability to design and implement technical solutions for business problems while balancing functionality, sustainability, time to delivery and costs.
Ability to develop and maintain current and future state technology architectures.
Advanced knowledge of and experience with computer vulnerabilities, hacker methodologies and other threats.
Intermediate skills in computer terminal and personal computer operation; Microsoft Office applications including but not limited to: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Ability to deal with complex challenges involving multiple facets and variables in non-standardized situations.

AtriCure, Inc. provides innovative technologies for the treatment of Afib and related conditions. Afib affects more than 33 million people worldwide. Electrophysiologists and cardiothoracic surgeons around the globe use AtriCure technologies for the treatment of Afib and reduction of Afib related complications. AtriCure’s Isolator® Synergy™ Ablation System is the first medical device to receive FDA approval for the treatment of persistent Afib. AtriCure’s AtriClip® Left Atrial Appendage Exclusion System products are the most widely sold LAA management devices worldwide. AtriCure’s Hybrid AF™ Therapy is a minimally invasive procedure that provides a lasting solution for long-standing persistent Afib patients. AtriCure’s cryoICE cryoSPHERE® probe is cleared for temporary ablation of peripheral nerves to block pain, providing pain relief in cardiac and thoracic procedures. For more information, visit AtriCure.com or follow us on Twitter @AtriCure.

We foster a culture of inclusion by embracing diverse experiences and individuals where everyone’s authentic self is welcome. We offer supporting programs and resources that provide enriching and equitable opportunities for each person to contribute professionally and personally.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Senior PLM Business Analyst (BA) will assist the PLM Business Solution Architect to consult and collaborate with business teams to capture and analyze current PLM business practices and systems, assist in architecting future state PLM solutions based on industry best practices enabled by computer-aided design (CAD), PLM and related technologies, and ensure technical alignment with AtriCure’s 3DExperience PLM platform. This role will partner with business stakeholders, Product Owners, SME’s, solution architects, data analysts, solution providers, and support personnel following the Agile framework and delivery. The PLM BA plays a critical role in capturing business, functional, system level requirements and serves as the liaison between the business and the IT development team to ensure the end solution adequately meets all requirements.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:

Assist the team in the design of future state PLM solutions (process models enabled by CAD, PLM and related technologies) based on industry best practices and aligned with Dassault ENOVIA 3DExperience PLM platform for the following areas: document management, quality management, advanced product configuration management, change control, managed CAD in PLM, systems engineering and requirements management, risk management (FMEAs), materials management and compliance, and integrations with CRM, ERP, MES, Reporting & Analytics platforms
Collaborate with business’ legacy system owners and IT to define the scope and requirements for migrating legacy PLM and CAD data to the configured 3DExperience application
Assist the team in archiving and retiring legacy systems and associated data
Perform basic mockups, configurations on the Dassault ENOVIA 3DExperience PLM platform to facilitate future state solutioning workshops and align with out-of-the-box capabilities to minimize configuration and customization effort

Summary

We're currently seeking a Sr. NetSuite Consultant based in the US for our client. The ideal candidate should resonate with our client's proactive, creative, collaborative, and relationship-oriented values. This is an on-site position but is open to remote work, with a requirement of a minimum of 2 days in the office per month

Company Overview
Our client is a US-based solution provider specializing in manufacturing systems innovation.

Responsibilities
Lead a large manufacturing implementation project and simultaneously oversee 2 smaller projects.
Collaborate with project team members, emphasizing personal growth in both subject and technical matters.
Proactively engage in face-to-face meetings, as well as phone and email communications, with key customers, including C-level executives.
Develop a deep understanding of product and consulting services, including integrations and PCT solution offerings, while continually enhancing consulting skills.
Plan, promote, participate in, and represent PCT in events, user groups, and community organizations where discussions about NetSuite, ERP, and/or Manufacturing take place.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering, science, mathematics, or a related field. Preferably hold an engineering degree in Mechanical, Manufacturing/Production, or Industrial Engineering.
Accumulate 5+ years of experience in the relevant field.
Possess NetSuite Certification, at least SuiteFoundation level.
Demonstrate experience in at least 5 end-to-end NetSuite Implementation projects.
Exhibit exceptional business analysis, verbal, and written communication skills.
Lead and design solutions for full-cycle NetSuite implementation projects, accommodating varying levels of size and complexity.
Translate complex business requirements and processes into NetSuite technical designs, either remotely or in-person as requested by the client, including video or onsite interactions.
Assume solution delivery responsibilities across all project phases: discovery, design, build, testing, training, and deployment.
Conduct fit/gap analysis on business requirements to inform system design and execution.
Develop custom solutions outlined in clear and comprehensive Functional Specifications.
Contribute to various internal Client initiatives, including resource mentorship and ongoing NetSuite education.
Display a willingness to learn and develop NetSuite/Manufacturing product skills in all areas as required by customer engagements.
Be open to travel, with an expectation of up to 50%, while in reality, anticipate traveling to customer sites for a maximum of one week per month.

GENERAL PURPOSE AND SCOPE OF THE POSITION:

The Human Resources (HR) Systems Architect develops, maintains, and enhances processes for technical solutions and best practices to improve and leverage Ivy Tech’s HR systems, primarily Workday Human Capital Management (HCM), to support Ivy Tech's objectives. Partnering with stakeholders across the organization to create and iterate on technology opportunities to streamline and create an exceptional employee experience for the organization. This position is responsible for maintaining the user experience of Workday HCM and leadership of the HR System Administration Team. The HR Systems Administration Team is responsible for managing a broad portfolio of HR applications, integrations, and reports delivered primarily through Workday HCM.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Maintains and enhances processes to design, develop, implement, optimize, and support Workday HCM configuration to meet business processes, capabilities, and needs.
Serves as the product owner for Workday HCM security and system-wide configurations.
In collaboration with the Vice President for Human Resources, develops and manages strategic plans for HR systems with input from the statewide HR team.
Acts as the Scrum Master for the HR Systems Administration Team: including identifying and addressing roadblocks, providing coaching, supporting team member roles, and supporting the agile mindset.
Identifies key risks and ensures mitigation to organization acceptable levels.
Responsible for the total quality assurance process for Workday HCM including configuration/code standards, configuration/code reviews, design and execution of test cases, and test scripts.
Ensures processes provide support to end users including hypercare for major releases.
Provides support to other analysts and ensures all Workday HCM release items are implemented timely.
Maintains knowledge of governmental and state audit practices and requirements relating to system configuration through multiple tenant environments.
Identifies inefficiencies in processes, suggests enhancements, and presents proposals to stakeholders for internal Workday enhancements.
Coordinates with other Workday architectures including attending committee and release meetings.
Fosters ongoing Workday relationships and customer partnerships within user groups and/or the Workday community to ensure understanding of all current and new functionality available.
Proactively learns new technologies, standards, and applications; to keep current with new developments in technology.
Researches, conceptualizes, and develops prototypes to test architectural concepts.
Optimizes systems for performance, scalability, reliability, extensibility, and total cost of ownership.
Develops and guides a culture of talent development to meet business objectives and strategy.
This is not to be construed as an exhaustive list. Other duties logically associated with this position may be assigned. All responsibilities will be conducted within the parameters of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), other applicable regulatory requirements, and professional standards.
SUPERVISION RECEIVED: Vice President for Human Resources
SUPERVISION GIVEN: Sr. Business Analyst (3), Business Analyst (2)
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor's degree required.
Must possess a minimum of five (5) years of progressing analysis, technical business analysis, and/or project management experience with a minimum of two (2) years of supervisory experience.
Professional experience with Workday HCM is required.
Must have a strong HR background with experience in one or more ERP implementation(s) and/or configuration(s) while maintaining a rigorous commitment to quality, security, and attention to detail.
Workday Certification is a requirement of the position and maintaining certification is required; candidates who are not certified will be considered for the position; however, they will need to successfully pass Workday certification as well as ongoing successful re-certification as an ongoing condition of employment.
Must demonstrate a strong understanding of data design and management.
Must be familiar with Agile methodologies and principles; preferably Certified ScrumMaster (CSM).
Strong experience in HR Enterprise Applications.
Must demonstrate a strong foundation in analytical and problem-solving skills.
Must be able to work under deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Must demonstrate the ability to analyze and document processes, procedures, etc.
Must demonstrate excellent customer service and communication skills.
Must be able to effectively lead and manage a team and be highly collaborative with other teams and stakeholders.
Must demonstrate the ability to promote an inclusive environment that reflects the broad diversity and backgrounds represented by our students and employees and which every individual feels respected and valued.
Willingness to learn new functions and technologies required.
